programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: In a bid to persuade Pearl to take back her errant husband, Howard's friends try to convince her he is living as a tramp - but he is far from happy at the prospect of going it alone in the wilderness. programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Wondering if Pearl still loves him, Howard asks Hobbo to give her a peck on the cheek from him - only to become even more despondent when he sees his wife deliver a passionate kiss. Meanwhile, Glenda sends Barry off to paint a landscape, hoping the activity will distract him from his hunger - but fish and chips is the only thing on his mind. Comedy, starring Russ Abbot, Robert Fyfe and Juliette Kaplan

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: Peter attends a conference with Barkway, his old professor from Cambridge (played by Richard Wilson), and finds himself drawn into a battle over a set of research papers. Meanwhile, Lyle is left to his own devices and finds himself inundated with clients wanting to take advantage of his generous will-making service - and an office full of cats. Elsewhere, Beatrice is close to her due date and has chosen her birthing partner. Drama, starring Stephen Fry, with guest star Diana Quick

programme.title: Maisie Raine
programme.desc: Maisie's errant brother Kelvin asks her to investigate the theft of money he won at a casino, but as inquiries proceed, the main suspect is assaulted, giving the case a sinister twist. Police drama, starring Pauline Quirke, Paul Reynolds and Eve Matheson

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Standing and the team reinvestigate the 50-year-old murder of Frederick Tully, a wages clerk at Battersea Power Station. Drama, guest starring George Cole, Roy Hudd and Jan Francis

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Harry is called to Budapest by Hungarian human rights lawyer Anna Sandor to perform a second post-mortem on the body of a drowned prostitute. He begins to help his lover investigate the suspicious death, but finds himself implicated in her murder when she is killed in her bed. The pathologist calls on Leo for help as he is forced to retreat underground while continuing to work on the case

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick journeys inland from the majestic Camel Estuary to one of Britain's finest vineyards, where he joins in harvesting the grapes to discover that the Cornish weather is perfect making some of the best wine in the country. Just off Pentire Point, as the sun sets, Rick rides the gentle swell of the north Atlantic with an old friend, casting his line to hook Britain's fastest fish, before firing up the barbecue to cook his catch with a recipe inspired from a trip to Goa. Rick joins Tim Smit, best known for starting the hugely successful Eden Project, who reveals to Rick his new and ambitious idea in Cornwall

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Businesswoman and Dragons' Den star Sara Davies takes Robson gorge-walking in Teesdale to introduce him to her way of getting close to nature. After overnighting in a shepherd's hut on a cheese farm, Robson heads to nearby Barnard Castle before visiting the nearby Raby country estate

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps an animal-loving house hunter from Oxfordshire to find a village property in Dorset, ideally close to the coast, and also visits a luxury yacht manufacturer

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam are in Stotfold, Bedfordshire, to create a colourful, peaceful retreat for Daniel and Saleha. The couple are both sun worshippers and would like colour and drama incorporated into the design, as well as a water feature, while Saleha has also asked for some nods to her Bangladeshi heritage

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Tim Medhurst explore Cumbria in a campervan, picking up a Scots Guards picture, a rare Scottish jug, and some silver jewellery

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Distraught Keanu desperately seeks ways to get Peggy back but is heartbroken to discover that a legal battle through the Portuguese courts could take years. Stacey plans a romantic rendezvous at the allotments with Martin, only to realise she has double booked with her client. Kathy is fuming at the knowledge Suki will be going on her honeymoon after Rocky lost it in a poker game to Nish, and Howie gives Kim a pep talk

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Painter Jemisha Maadhavji creates artwork of junior doctor Grace, who sustained a life-altering spinal cord injury during her studies when a man jumped from a third-floor balcony and landed on her. She discusses how using a wheelchair can be an advantage in her work in a busy London A&E department, as it places her at eye level to patients in their beds, allowing her to better connect with them

programme.title: The Sixth Commandment
programme.desc: The true picture comes to light when Thames Valley Police open an investigation. The police trawl through evidence and make a connection between Peter's and Ann's symptoms. They have a working hypothesis, but what they desperately need is proof. Evidence starts to pile up and the police soon realise that they could be dealing with a frighteningly complex and calculating criminal mind

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: We Hunt Together
programme.desc: Freddy's dark history surfaces as she and Baba don Halloween masks to gain entry to her old school. Jackson and Lola find evidence that links the pair to the third victim, but will they join the dots in time to save a fourth? Psychological thriller, starring Eve Myles and Babou Ceesay

programme.title: Ordinary Love (2019)
programme.desc: When loving wife Joan feels a lump in her breast, she and husband Tom attempt to navigate the world of serious illness, including the surgery, radiation and chemotherapy. Lisa Barros D'Sa and Glenn Leyburn's critically acclaimed drama based on a script by playwright Owen McCafferty, starring Lesley Manville, Liam Neeson and Esh Alladi

With commentary by Vicki Sparks and Karen Bardsley

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the Fowey Estuary, one of Cornwall's hidden secrets, joining a friend on a boat trip to learn about the history of the area and getting a unique view of the buildings along the riverbank. He discovers the area's history of piracy, meets a family that make award-winning vodka, and makes a pancake with a wild blackberry compote and Cornish clotted cream

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Robson and his Grantchester co-star Tom Brittney take a road trip around County Durham, where they go dragonboat racing on the Wear a journey on the oldest railway in the world at Tanfield. They also spend a night in a forest camp, where they forage for food, enjoy a campfire sing-song and a sleep in self-erected hammocks

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps an aspiring writer who wants to make a dramatic relocation from the frenetic bustle of east London to the rural idylls of Dumfries and Galloway in Scotland. With a budget of 300,000, he has his sights set on somewhere isolated that will inspire his creativity. Away from the houses, Alistair heads for the hills hoping to strike it lucky on a Scottish gold rush

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: In Swindon, Catherine is recovering from multiple brain surgeries and wants a garden in which to relax and recuperate. She would like its design to reflect the period character of her Victorian terraced property and has a budget of 3,000 to achieve this. Designers Chris Hull and Lee Burkhill rise to the challenge, with both having peace and calm at the core of their proposed schemes

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Tim Medhurst tour the Lake District looking for bargains, picking up a French carriage clock, a Chinese pepperette and a Derbyshire candlestick

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Konnie Huq

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Vick Hope and Jermaine Jenas present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: After talking to Jean, Martin resolves to come to terms with Stacey's cam work and the two go out for dinner - but it soon becomes clear he is far from happy. Howie tries to persuade Kim to log off so she can go to her therapy appointment, while the stakes get high for Suki and Kathy

programme.title: What They Really Mean For You
programme.desc: Michelle Ackerley presents the first of two programmes exploring aspects of modern life that need to change to protect the environment, which focuses on the switch to electric cars. The programme explores the obstacles in electric vehicles becoming the standard, from cost to the difficulty of charging, while BBC Climate Editor Justin Rowlatt explores if the UK is on track to hit the government's targets to stop emitting greenhouse gases by 2050

programme.title: The Sixth Commandment
programme.desc: Ben Field stands trial for Peter Farquhar's murder and conspiring to murder Ann Moore-Martin. After a long day in court, tensions rise between Ann-Marie and Simon as the press swarm, while Ben remains unflappable in the face of cross-examination. As the final day dawns, the hunt is on for the final piece of the puzzle that can prove murder was committed

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Comedian Chris Ramsey researches his family tree, starting by investigating his great grandfather who fought in the First World War. A trip to the military base in Dorset where he trained, reveals he fought at Gallipoli, one of the deadliest campaigns of the conflict. Tracing back to the late 18th century, Chris revisits the era when his five-times great grandmother was pregnant. This was a time when those lucky enough to pass a rigorous interview and then win a lottery were able to give birth at the British Lying-In Hospital, thus helping ensure their children got a better start in life. Narrated by Phil Davis

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: An '80s 'mean girl' ghost named Stephanie, who died on her prom night, is awakened in the attic, triggering Sam to confront what happened on her own prom night

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: Jay and Sam are ready to open their bed-and-breakfast, unleashing a horde of bored ghosts on unsuspecting guests - but Thor's pettiness comes back to bite them

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: The simple stop and search of a suspicious man leads to the arrest of a serial killer and a police officer's instinct leads to an armed stand-off in an isolated beauty spot. Plus, a road traffic collision leads to the discovery of a massive fraud with thousands of victims

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble meets a young zebra in crisis, Ben Fogle plays Sherlock Holmes to find escaped porcupines, and Jean Johansson learns what happens when a lion comes face to face with itself

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and a four-legged friend visit a semi-detached house in Swansea, and Martel Maxwell explores a terrace in Bishop Auckland, Co Durham. Plus, news on a plot of land in Bolton, Lancashire, first featured in 2019

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from Detling, and challenges people to guess what an unusual gadget is for. Thomas Forrester and Ochuko Ojiri assist the teams

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: On the wild north Atlantic coast, Rick heads out to sea to go fishing for lobsters with his old friend and celebrity chef Nathan Outlaw, before helping to cook up a lobster risotto. Later, at Tresillian House near Newquay, Rick meets with head gardener John Harris to find out more about his Victorian walled garden

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Robson invites TV presenter Steph McGovern on a journey around Northumberland. They search for ingredients for dinner with the help of a beach foraging expert, harness the wind to try their hands at kite buggying here they enjoy beach foraging, kite buggying and go looking for tiny wildlife on a bug safari

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A young married couple seek to escape London's Docklands and move to the Chiltern Hills of Buckinghamshire. Guided by Ginny Buckley, and with a healthy budget of 850,000, they want to realise their dream of raising their family with more room inside and more green space outside. The property search happens to fall in the same week as the Henley Regatta, where Ginny gets behind the scenes with rowing royalty at this famous societal sporting event

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Leonard and Cristina's garden in Birmingham doesn't get much sun and has an awkward slope right in the middle. Designers Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill both think they have the answer - and go head to head to persuade the pair in invest their 3,000 budget in their respective visions of the ideal multi-functional family garden

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Tim Medhurst's antique trail takes them to the Isle of Man, where Tim picks up a captain's chair, a pair of bears, a bronzed sculpture of a footballer, while Margie plays it safer with a bargain antique corkscrew, as well as a cocktail shaker and a sewing machine

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Konnie Huq

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and Alex Jones round off the working week with the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey decides to tell Martin what happens during her secret cam dates so he fully understands, but Theo overhears and is angry that they presume he must be a sad, old man. Kim and Howie fall out over her plans to talk about mental health online. Freddie encourages a dejected Alfie to use the power of positive thinking

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team bring three treasured family heirlooms - and the memories they hold - back to life. Stephen Kember mends a cherished but sadly long mute music box. Bequeathed to Betty Hill by her beloved father, a professional stage magician, this miniature item presents an exacting undertaking for the restorer. A much-loved pushalong horse, and revive a water-damaged penny arcade game are also rejuvenated

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Will Kirk visit 88-year-old Pattie. Widowed and forced to downsize, it's time to declutter and enjoy a holiday with the proceeds of the pop-up auction

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe presents the grand final, with judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young kicking things off by challenging the sewers to make a Victoriana-style evening dress. These dresses require delicate fabrics to create the glamorous effect, but they are tricky to handle. Next, it's the sewers' last chance to show off their instinct for design in the transformation challenge, as they attempt to turn female party wear into a glamorous men's red-carpet outfit. Finally, they fit a Met Gala-worthy 'two-in-one' dress for their models, who this week are a friend or family member

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Comedy about a young aspiring film-maker trapped in a recruitment job. When Kwabena bumps into an old friend from film school who is now working at a production company, he gets the chance that he has been waiting for. Unfortunately, she fixes him a once-in-a-lifetime pitching opportunity that clashes with a career-saving presentation - forcing him to choose between going all in or giving up his dream entirely. Co-written by and starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena moonlights as a food delivery driver to finance his film, but feels his new job makes him beneath Vanessa, so he struggles to keep it a secret. Things start to look up when he is hired by Funmi to film her eccentric aunt's 60th birthday party, and gets an intriguing tip from an old film school friend. Amy pushes for a promotion at work, and Maurice is anxious about fatherhood. Guest starring Peter Serafinowicz and Jo Martin

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Footballer Troy Deeney, heavyweight boxer Joe Joyce, mixed martial arts star Tom Aspinall, and World Champion swimmer Hannah Miley join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: USA v Netherlands (Kick-off 2.00am). All the action from the Group E encounter at Wellington Regional Stadium in New Zealand, as both teams play their second match. This is a repeat of the 2019 final, which the Americans won 2-0 in France. Reshmin Chowdhury presents, with analysis from Anita Asante and Fern Williams, and commentary by Steve Wyeth and Fara Williams

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team reports from the biggest horticultural event in the north - the RHS Flower Show Tatton Park. Joe Swift and Frances Tophill reveal the latest in garden design, as well as bringing plant perfection from some of the best nurseries and growers in the country. Also, Nick Bailey shines a botanical spotlight on begonias, and Toby Buckland visits a Liverpool community who have regenerated their streets through collective gardening

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Nick Knowles explains how brave rescuers risked their lives evacuating residents from a burning high-rise. Plus, a woman who came to the aid of her best friend when she unexpectedly went into cardiac arrest

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: The newsreader heads to Naples, immersing himself in its famous street life and trying his hand at crafting one of the city's characterful Nativity figurines and bagging a backstage pass to the world's oldest opera house

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from London's Docklands to the Barbican, examining the story of the arrival at Tilbury in 1948 of the Empire Windrush, which brought more than a thousand passengers from the Caribbean to work in Britain. In Limehouse, Michael reflects on the Labour Party's landslide victory at the post-war general election of 1945 and hears what drove new prime minister Clement Attlee to strive for social change

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair to answer questions on the specialist subjects of he Weimar Republic, Alex Higgins, the bridges of London, and UK cheeses, before each is tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Two returnees and a newcomer make their way to the kitchen for the Central heats, preparing their starters and fish courses. Sabrina Gidda from Wolverhampton is executive chef at AllBright, a women-only club in London. Newcomer Kray Treadwell from Solihull is head chef at Man Behind the Curtain in Leeds, while Ryan Simpson-Trotman - making his third appearance in the competition - runs his own restaurant, Orwells in Oxfordshire

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Nick Knowles challenges three artists to create a suitable piece to celebrate the upcoming wedding of paraclimbing champion Richard and fiancee Keely. Can a metal sculptor, a stained-glass designer or a paint and textile artist create just what the pair are looking for?

programme.title: Made in Great Britain
programme.desc: The makers explore how Northampton became the shoe capital of Britain, as Steph McGovern takes them through the ages, guided by master shoemaker Scott McKee, who has hand-made shoes for dozens of high profile clients including Prince Charles and Daniel Craig. The makers start by recreating a 13th century turn shoe, then become part of the Victorian-era production line for the heeled Oxford shoe. Other tasks include producing a Second World-War marching boot that kitted out the British army and working on modern leather brogue boots

programme.title: Great Alaskan Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo returns to explore more of the US rail network, this time heading across the state of Alaska to examine the lives and customs of its inhabitants while armed with his 1899 Appleton's Guide-Book to Alaska, written by intrepid 19th-century explorer Eliza Ruhamah Scidmore

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Experts Catherine Southon and Katherine Higgins are at the Royal Marines Museum in Hampshire, where a 19th-century Japanese woodblock and a pristine pocket watch stimulate interest. Meanwhile, presenter Paul Martin learns how Portsmouth influenced the Victorian author Charles Dickens

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Sara Barron, Sanjeev Kohli, Josie Long and Gregg Wallace test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Sheep farming couple David and Charlotte, and father daughter duo James and Hannah compete with the best of their flocks at Kilnsey Show in the Yorkshire Dales

programme.title: The Secret Genius of Modern Life
programme.desc: Hannah Fry delves into the inner workings of virtual assistants, like Google Assistant and Siri, which are now found in almost half of all UK homes. She goes behind the scenes with Alexa's chief scientist, reveals how secret technology invented to hunt U-boats led to their targeted hearing, and discovers modern wi-fi's debt to a 1940s Hollywood star

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts another first-round match as rock music fans the Roadies take on embroidery enthusiasts the Stitchers. The teams must use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between four things that may appear at first not to be linked, with one set of clues comprising Way in, Outside the works, Mouth entertainment, and Little ovens

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the second of the academic quiz's first-round matches, four students from the University of Aberdeen pit their wits against a team from the University of Birmingham in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition. Amol Rajan asks the questions

programme.title: Earth
programme.desc: Chris Packham tells the story of the event 800 million years ago when almost the entire planet froze and the chances of life surviving hung in the balance. Earth's journey into the deep freeze started with fire when the giant supercontinent Rodinia broke up and vast powerful tectonic forces ripped the land apart, kicking off a series of events that resulted in huge amounts of carbon dioxide being sucked from the atmosphere - sending global temperatures plummeting

programme.title: That Mitchell and Webb Look
programme.desc: Sketches include a man who can move biscuits with his mind, and a clip from new daytime TV show Coverage of People Buying a House and Then Living in It. An evil henchman also makes a plea for death threats to be worded more clearly. David Mitchell and Robert Webb star. First aired in 2006

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: The World's War: Forgotten Soldiers of Empire
programme.desc: Part two of two. Historian and film-maker David Olusoga explores how Germany enlisted Muslims from north Africa and the Middle East to join the fight against Britain and its allies during the First World War. Muslim PoWs and deserters held in special camps in Germany were indoctrinated to see Kaiser Wilhelm II as a lover of Islam and a supporter of national independence wherever the British or French flags flew. General Paul von Lettow-Vorbeck led an army of east African troops in an insurgency that cost the lives of hundreds of thousands of black troops

programme.title: Why Sharks Attack
programme.desc: Following three shark attacks in two years just metres from a beach in the Red Sea vacation resort of Hurghada, Egypt, this documentary investigates the recent shift in shark behaviour and whether human activity and climate change could be the causes. Professor Gavin Naylor of the University of Florida looks back to the evolution of sharks for answers while Dr Dean Grubbs of Florida State University gets hands on, catching sharks to study and better understand their movements. Dr Laura Ryan, of Macquarie University, explains her research into a possible case of mistaken identity in which the sharks are mistaking humans for their preferred prey of seals.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Sammi Kinghorn are in the Lake District finding out how cycling is still one of the top outdoor pursuits in the UK, and how electric bikes are opening up the countryside like never before. Adam Henson talks to farmers taking part in a sheep shearing competition, and Tom Heap explores the impact of banning snares

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: A series of burglaries allows police to crack county-lines drug-dealing conspiracy, a consumer complaint brings down a national SMS fraud and a jet-setting con-woman is brought to justice

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Nick Knowles recounts the story of an injured lone walker, lost for two nights during a storm on the Isle of Skye. Plus, how a young woman suffered a terrifying encounter with a pink river dolphin while in travelling in Bolivia

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents the show from Kingston Antiques Centre, south-west London, with the red and blue teams guided by experts Charles Hanson and Thomas Forrester. Away from the contest, Natasha meets a local artist and learns about a photographic technique that is over 150 years old, before trying her hand at it herself

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive makes a wriggly catch on a fishing expedition across Europe's biggest volcanic lake, and discovers how scientists are fighting to save an ancient citadel from destruction

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo visits several of London's most famous locations, beginning on the South Bank, where the 1951 Festival of Britain drew more than eight and a half million visitors to admire fantastical buildings designed to inspire and celebrate the best of British in art, science and industry. After a spin on the London Eye, built to celebrate the millennium, Michael takes the London Underground to Chelsea to find out about Elizabeth David, one of the most influential cookery writers of the 20th century, and also heads to Covent Garden and Regent's Park

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair to answer questions on the specialist subjects Joe Calzaghe, the Beach Boys, Joseph Stalin, and the Gospel of John, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The Central chefs are at the halfway point of their heat, serving up their music-themed mains and desserts. Ryan Simpson-Trotman hopes his dish - The UK's Number 1 - will hit the top spot with its combination of beef pie and rump cap. Sabrina Gidda is taking inspiration from her grandad's collection of old 45s for her Sunday Jukebox main of pork Wellington and Black Country faggots, while Kray is combining Wagyu beef, American-style scones and purple potatoes for 'Shaarron', dedicated to Birmingham's own Black Sabbath and Ozzy Osbourne

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Three talented artists to make something special for the homes of people they've never met. In Lincolnshire, a buyer is looking for a gift for her husband as a thank-you for all he does for the family and to mark his long service to charity work. Will a stone sculptor, a mosaic-maker or an illustrator create the perfect present? Presented by Nick Knowles

programme.title: Earth's Natural Wonders
programme.desc: Footage of some of the most breathtaking places on Earth, following the lives of some of the people who call these extraordinary places home. In the first episode, cameras follow yak-herder Thokmay Lowa as he leads his herd through one of the most treacherous mountain passes in the high Himalaya. Elsewhere, the programme follows members of Inuit communities in the Canadian Arctic as they take part in the hazardous mussel harvest, and people in Siberia searching for mammoth tusks, now released from the Siberian Permafrost after thousands of years

programme.title: Great Alaskan Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo is in Anchorage, preparing to join the US Arctic Warriors for parachute-training at joint forces base Elmendorf-Richardson. The role of the military in Alaska since its purchase from Russia in 1867 underlines to him the strategic importance of the 49th state in two World Wars

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin hosts from Rochester Cathedral in Kent, where antiques expert Elizabeth Talbot falls for a book of fairy tales illustrated by Arthur Rackham, and Adam Partridge discovers an elegant chiming Swiss pocket watch. Paul also meets one of the last remaining survivors of the Dunkirk evacuation during the Second World War

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Sara Barron, Sanjeev Kohli, Josie Long and Gregg Wallace test their general knowledge skills, while Richard Osman asks the questions

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Veg grower Greg and cattle farmers Sophie and Tim head to Lavenham Farmers' Market with their freshest produce hoping for a successful day in the Suffolk sunshine

programme.title: The Secret Genius of Modern Life
programme.desc: Hannah Fry discovers why innovations in meat-packing almost derailed the electric car revolution. She also reveals how a breakthrough in camcorder batteries led to Elon Musk's electric empire, and shows how not to drive a multi-million dollar prototype car of the future

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Caitriona and Kevin thought they had hit the property jackpot after moving from a tiny flat to a three-bedroom house in Rickmansworth, Herefordshire. But as they have discovered, there is no comfortable family space downstairs, the kitchen is cramped and their growing twins squabble over who has to sleep in the tiny box room every night. Enter architects Damion Burrows and Lynsey Elliott, who come up with alternative VR solutions to the couple's property problems - only one of which they can make a reality. Presented by Angela Scanlon

programme.title: Inside Dubai: Playground of the Rich
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on some of the aspirational Brits who are choosing to live and work in Dubai and see how the people attracted there have changed over the course of its brief 50-year history. Mark is fresh off the plane having quit his job stacking shelves in a supermarket back home in Newcastle, but an unexpected offer of work presents him with a difficult decision

programme.title: Best of Little Miss Jocelyn
programme.desc: Compilation of the best sketches from the comedy show, starring Jocelyn Jee Esien. Characters include a woman with worms, an overzealous traffic warden and a polygamous wife who drags her husbands to marriage guidance counselling

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Detroit (2017)
programme.desc: A group of rogue police officers responds to a complaint with apparent retribution rather than justice in mind, launching a raid on a group of African-Americans. Public anger reaches a peak after the incident, as relationships sour with authority. Fact-based drama set during the 1967 Detroit riots, starring John Boyega, Anthony Mackie and Algee Smith

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The remaining sewers work with utilitarian clothing to make unique garments for a chance to make it to the final. They begin by making a trench coat out of an old military uniform and go on to make a garment of their own choice from cleaning products, including cloths, rubber gloves and mop heads. In the made-to-measure challenge, the semi-finalists take boiler suits and fit them perfectly to their models

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon investigate the food delivery giants making customers pay for items that were out of stock and never delivered. Plus, the issue of vouchers promised for holidays cancelled during the pandemic

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Kirsty Wilson and Carole Baxter thin out the bamboo next to the pond and plant up a hanging basket full of herbs. Calum Clunie sends in the latest update from his allotment in Leven and George Anderson reveals a different way to propagate new plants. Plus, father-and-daughter gardeners Erin and Joe Armstrong work and garden together at their plot in East Lothian

programme.title: Earth
programme.desc: Chris Packham presents this four-and-a-half-billion-year history of the planet, with each episode taking viewers on a journey through a pivotal moment when the Earth's future hung in the balance. The story begins with one of the darkest periods in the planet's history 252 million years ago - the worst mass extinction it has ever seen, when as much as 90 per cent of all species died

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Spain v Zambia (Kick-off 8.30am). All the action from both teams' second Group B match, which comes from Eden Park in Auckland, New Zealand. Spain reached the last 16 four years ago and will expect to take the points against the tournament debutantes. Reshmin Chowdhury presents, with analysis from Fara Williams and Anita Asante, and commentary by Vicki Sparks and Karen Bardsley

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Ruth Goodman heads to Polperro to get some tips for completing a complex fisherman's jumper and Tessa Dunlop takes the plunge into the glamorous history of British lidos

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair to answer questions on the specialist subjects of freshwater fish of the British Isles, Nick Cave, the history of scouting in the UK, and Lin-Manuel Miranda, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining Central region chefs must cook their four-course menus again, though it remains to be seen whether they have successfully taken on board feedback from their earlier submissions. The duo need to impress food writer Matthew Fort, restaurateur Oliver Peyton, broadcaster and cook Andi Oliver, as well as guest judge singer-songwriters and UB40 member Ali Campbell

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of recipes to sate cravings for a takeaway, including fish and chips from James Martin and a pizza recipe from Keith Floyd

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: A fibre artist, a ceramicist and an abstract painter create artworks for a Staffordshire who woman wants a piece to mark the birth of her first grandchild. Nick Knowles presents

programme.title: Earth's Natural Wonders
programme.desc: Focusing on the relationships between animals and people living in some of the world's most extraordinary natural wonders, this episode follows nomadic people from the Yamal Peninsula in northern Siberia, as they hunt one of the very few animals that can survive in this frozen environment, reindeer. Elsewhere, cameras observe a local ranger in the coastal salt marshes of Northern Australia's Arnhem Land, as he goes in search of the eggs of one of the world's most aggressive predators, the saltwater crocodile

programme.title: Great Alaskan Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey north on the Alaskan Railroad as he reaches to the quaint town of Talkeetna, where he helps fell a tree to clear land for a log cabin in a forest outside of town. From Talkeetna, Michael boards the Hurricane Turn, before arriving at the Denali National Park, crowned by the highest peak in the United States

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Antiques expert Elizabeth Talbot discovers a valuable sculpture at Rochester Cathedral in Kent and Raj Bisram finds a ghostly Victorian photo album

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: John, Lucy and Oliver take their shire horses to compete in Heckington Show in Lincolnshire

programme.title: The Secret Genius of Modern Life
programme.desc: Hannah Fry visits eBay's Authentication Centre where they're waging war against fake high value trainers. She discovers how American breakfast waffles transformed the sports shoe's soles, and how an 18th-century tea set led to the use of celebrity endorsement

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Lochs
programme.desc: Paul Murton travels from the shores of Loch Hope to the glorious and lonely expanse of Sandwood Bay in the far north-west of the country. Along the way he encounters a Pictish king and an ancient Broch, discovers wartime secrets in Loch Eriboll and a hidden monument to a naval disaster

programme.title: Dial M for Middlesbrough
programme.desc: Johnny Vegas and Sian Gibson return as Terry and Gemma from Draper's Tours, this time finding themselves forced to take refuge at a sinister and dilapidated caravan park after their coach breaks down. During the unplanned stay, visitors and residents begin to be bumped off one by one under grizzly circumstances. Black comedy, co-starring Sally Lindsay, Phil Davis, Joanna Page, Jason Donovan and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Earth
programme.desc: Chris Packham tells the story of the event 800 million years ago when almost the entire planet froze and the chances of life surviving hung in the balance. Earth's journey into the deep freeze started with fire when the giant supercontinent Rodinia broke up and vast powerful tectonic forces ripped the land apart, kicking off a series of events that resulted in huge amounts of carbon dioxide being sucked from the atmosphere - sending global temperatures plummeting

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Architects Will Foster and Lizzie Fraher offer up some designs to help Reena and Wes create more space in their three-bedroom 1960s terrace house in Borehamwood, which they've outgrown since moving in 12 years ago. With Wes often working from home, daughter Nyla's toys are competing for space with the desk and the kitchen doesn't have space for a table, so they eat all their meal on their knees in the living room. With family in Barbados and in the UK, Reena and Wes are desperate to create some space to get everyone together

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team visits busy mum Monique at her two-bedroom home in south east London. In just 24 hours, on a limited budget, the team create special bunkbed spaces for her two daughters, address the overspill of toys with bespoke storage solutions, and give their bathroom a deep clean

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A con woman posing as a grieving widow fakes her husband's death, and a mechanic's dodgy 50,000 claim for a car jack injury is stopped in its tracks by investigators

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: How a pharmacy took a stand against shoplifters by creating a 'wall of shame' and the introduction of an innovative bodycam able to help shopkeepers identify prolific shoplifters and abusive customers. Plus, the work of a vehicle forensics expert following a ram raid on a jewellers in Leeds. Presented by Rav Wilding

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels around the British Isles by train, immersing himself in the magnificent scenery of the nation's coastal regions. Meeting locals, he discovers passion and pride in their history, culture and identity, and seeks to understand the challenges each region faces today. He begins at Siccar Point in Berwickshire, which was the site of an extraordinary 18th-century discovery and is a place of pilgrimage for earth scientists from across the world

programme.title: Secrets of Bones
programme.desc: Evolutionary biologist Ben Garrod explores how vertebrates capture and devour their food, looking at adaptations in their skeletons that help them eat. The presenter examines the jaws of a sperm whale, finds out which animal has teeth that weigh 5kg each, and reveals which creature uses its skull as a suction pump

programme.title: Treasures of the Indus
programme.desc: Historian and museum curator Sona Datta explores the story of the Indian subcontinent told through its people, places and dynasties, and looking at their effect on the modern world. She begins by investigating Pakistan's intriguing multicultural past, which also produced some extraordinary and little-known works of art

programme.title: Murder on the Victorian Railway
programme.desc: Drama-documentary examining the death of banker Thomas Briggs in July 1864, which was the first murder to be committed on a British train. The film uses testimonies from court transcripts, memoirs, letters and newspaper reports to tell the story of the crime through those connected to it, including engine driver Alfred Ekin - who found the body - and Richard Tanner, the detective in charge of the investigation. It also explores the huge public outcry and debate it provoked. Narrated by Toby Jones

programme.title: Naples '44
programme.desc: A portrait of the city at the end of the Second World War, using British intelligence operative Norman Lewis' first-hand accounts, read by Benedict Cumberbatch. They describe a city devastated by Fascism, bombings, Nazi occupation and the Allied invasion, combined with archive footage of Naples in later years, as life returned to the city

programme.title: Colouring Light: Brian Clarke - An Artist Apart
programme.desc: A profile of the Oldham-born painter and stained-glass artist, whose creations have featured in buildings by architects including Norman Foster and Arata Isozaki. He returns to Lancashire, where he recalls his working-class upbringing, and tells the story of his rise to international fame. The film features many of his most famous works, as well as contributions by art historian Martin Harrison and architects Zaha Hadid and Peter Cook

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: Classic 1970s documentary examining the social and intellectual evolution of the human race. Dr Jacob Bronowski begins in Africa's Great Rift Valley, where he traces the evolution of man's unique gifts - foresight and imagination. First shown in 1973

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: Dr Jacob Bronowski's account of the social and intellectual evolution of the human race looks at the move mankind made from a nomadic lifestyle to settled agriculture, with the domestication of the horse and the cultivation of wheat. First shown in 1973

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels around the British Isles by train, immersing himself in the magnificent scenery of the nation's coastal regions. Meeting locals, he discovers passion and pride in their history, culture and identity, and seeks to understand the challenges each region faces today. He begins at Siccar Point in Berwickshire, which was the site of an extraordinary 18th-century discovery and is a place of pilgrimage for earth scientists from across the world

programme.title: Secrets of Bones

programme.title: Treasures of the Indus
programme.desc: Historian and museum curator Sona Datta explores the story of the Indian subcontinent told through its people, places and dynasties, and looking at their effect on the modern world. She begins by investigating Pakistan's intriguing multicultural past, which also produced some extraordinary and little-known works of art

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his Scottish coastal journey along the Firth of Forth at the railway engineering icon for which it is famous throughout the world, the Forth Bridge, and reminisces about his delight in the crossing as a child visiting his Scottish grandparents. On the Firth's southern bank, Michael stops in the port of Leith to tour the Royal Yacht Britannia, before crossing the River Forth at Stirling and heading east to Alloa on the northern bank

programme.title: Secrets of Bones
programme.desc: Evolutionary biologist Ben Garrod explores the role skeletons play in aiding reproduction, looking at the ways courtship, competition and copulation have been improved by having bones. On his journey, he meets baseball players and drops a 10kg weight on a sheep's skull

programme.title: Hancock's Half Hour
programme.desc: Tony causes chaos on a cruise and has to be locked up when he convinces himself the ship is sinking. With Tony Hancock, Sidney James and Hattie Jacques

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: As Bob's wedding day dawns, a frustrated Terry continues to wreak havoc on people who happen to be unfortunate enough to live near him. Comedy, starring Rodney Bewes and James Bolam

programme.title: John Le Mesurier: It's All Been Rather Lovely
programme.desc: A portrait of the prolific actor's life and career, from his turbulent marriage to Hattie Jacques to his renowned role as Sgt Wilson in the TV sitcom Dad's Army and parts in more than 100 films. Featuring contributions by Michael Palin, Clive Dunn, Ian Lavender, Jimmy Perry and Joan Le Mesurier. Narrated by Julian Rhind-Tutt

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: The history of the steamers which were once a common sight on rivers and coastal waters around Britain and were a highlight of seaside holidays from the 1820s until the early 1960s, providing the adventure and trappings of an ocean voyage without venturing out of sight of land

programme.title: Origins of Us
programme.desc: Anatomist and anthropologist Alice Roberts concludes her exploration of the body and human evolution, focusing on the brain. She explores the importance of man's large brain in enabling him to succeed and asks why Homo sapiens survived where other human species, like the Neanderthals, died out

programme.title: Colouring Light: Brian Clarke - An Artist Apart
programme.desc: A profile of the Oldham-born painter and stained-glass artist, whose creations have featured in buildings by architects including Norman Foster and Arata Isozaki. He returns to Lancashire, where he recalls his working-class upbringing, and tells the story of his rise to international fame. The film features many of his most famous works, as well as contributions by art historian Martin Harrison and architects Zaha Hadid and Peter Cook

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his Scottish coastal journey along the Firth of Forth at the railway engineering icon for which it is famous throughout the world, the Forth Bridge, and reminisces about his delight in the crossing as a child visiting his Scottish grandparents. On the Firth's southern bank, Michael stops in the port of Leith to tour the Royal Yacht Britannia, before crossing the River Forth at Stirling and heading east to Alloa on the northern bank

programme.title: Secrets of Bones
programme.desc: Evolutionary biologist Ben Garrod explores the role skeletons play in aiding reproduction, looking at the ways courtship, competition and copulation have been improved by having bones. On his journey, he meets baseball players and drops a 10kg weight on a sheep's skull

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: The history of the steamers which were once a common sight on rivers and coastal waters around Britain and were a highlight of seaside holidays from the 1820s until the early 1960s, providing the adventure and trappings of an ocean voyage without venturing out of sight of land

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins this leg of his Scottish railway journey from Dunbar to Peterhead in the beautiful medieval city of Stirling. At a towering monument overlooking the River Forth, Michael hears how, in 1297, William Wallace inflicted a shocking defeat on the English army at Stirling Bridge. Travelling across country to the River Tay, Michael discovers the city of Perth, before heading to the banks of the Tay for a magical sunset canoe trip to spot beavers

programme.title: Secrets of Skin
programme.desc: Biologist Ben Garrod examines the evolution of skin - the largest organ in any creature's body - across all species of the animal kingdom, beginning by looking at how that of vertebrates has allowed them to conquer the planet.

programme.title: Patagonia: Earth's Secret Paradise
programme.desc: A glimpse at the rarely seen South American wilderness, home to a range of creatures from terrain as varied as the Andes to Cape Horn. Cameras reveal the secret lives of pumas and hummingbirds, soar with condors over glacial peaks and explore monkey puzzle forests dating back to the time of the dinosaurs. The extreme kayakers who gain thrills and excitement from traversing the area's raging waterfalls are observed, as are the native cowboys, known as gauchos, as they round up wild horses. Narrated by Santiago Cabrera

programme.title: Immortal Egypt with Joann Fletcher
programme.desc: Joann explores the peak of ancient Egyptian civilisation by looking at the Colossi of Memnon, two massive stone statues depicting Pharaoh Amenhotep III, and examining the lives of the workers and artisans involved in the building of the Valley of the Kings. This golden age was threatened by the growing power of Karnak's priests, and Joann reveals how Tutankhamen's early death was a chance for Egypt to start afresh and rewrite history, but was undermined by decades of state-sanctioned looting of the tombs

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Alan Yentob's seminal documentary following the musician across America on his 1974 Diamond Dogs tour, at a time when his rock star excesses were at their most extreme. Originally shown as part of Omnibus in 1975, the film features revealing footage of Bowie and his fans, illustrating the effects of fame on musicians and their followers

programme.title: Zoe Wanamaker Remembers - Bowie and Baal
programme.desc: The actress looks back at the 1982 TV adaptation of Bertolt Brecht's play, in which she appeared alongside David Bowie in the title role

programme.title: Baal with David Bowie
programme.desc: David Bowie stars in this 1982 adaptation of Bertolt Brecht's first play. Set in pre-First World War Germany, it depicts scenes from the life of an amoral poet and singer during ruthlessly devoted to his own talent. He loves nature and the universe with a passion, but is coldly indifferent to all ordinary human feeling. Adapted by John Willett, and featuring appearances by Robert Austin, Jonathan Kent, Julian Wadham, Zoe Wanamaker and Polly James

programme.title: Westwood: Punk - Icon - Activist
programme.desc: Documentary film reflecting on the extraordinary career of fashion designer Vivienne Westwood, looking closely at her artistry, her activism and her cultural significance. Featuring contributions from Westwood herself, as well as Pamela Anderson, Christina Hendricks and Kate Moss

After years of worrying, attending various hospital appointments and using medicines that didn't improve condition significantly, she decided to shave her hair off at the age of tejn. Now she embraces her beautiful bald look, but sometimes chooses to wear a wig. With the support of her twin brother and family we take a look into her life. programme.desc: Coding Genius follows 11-tear-old Emmanuella, who has a passion for coding. She hit the headlines in the UK after setting up lessons for school kids like her and is determined to go further. Now based in the Nigerian capital Abuja, Emmanuella has work to do - she wants to pass on her love of coding to other girls in the city and launches CodeKid, an after-school, weekend and holiday club for girls aged 6 - 15. But will they turn up, or will the thought of coding keep them away? In this short film, we find out what started Emmanuella's love of coding, and get to know her extraordinary ambitions for changing the world, one coding club at a time.

programme.desc: Fred and Pete find a heavy metal thing buried in the sand on the beach. Its got little windows in, and as Fred discovers, its full of gunky seaweed. But what is it? Archie reveals that this object will keep you safe and sound, while Suzy finds a photo of a friend of hers with a big metal object just like the one Fred and Pete found. programme.title: Fred & Pete's Treasure Tales
programme.desc: While out treasure-hunting, Fred stubs his toe on a metal bucket buried in the earth, but what is it? They decide to stick it in the Treasure Truck and head off to the Museum of Cornish Treasures. Suzy identifies it as a bucket made of tin, an important metal in the history of Cornwall. Archie the robot gives them a clue that the secret of their treasure can be found where people once dug underground. Connecting the two, Suzy sends Fred and Pete off to the tin mines. Jack, the manager of Geevor Tin Mine, gives Fred and Pete an underground tour and explains that tin was mined in Cornwall for thousands of years and used to make all sorts of objects. A trip to the military base in Dorset where he trained, reveals he fought at Gallipoli, one of the deadliest campaigns of the conflict. Tracing back to the late 18th century, Chris revisits the era when his five-times great grandmother was pregnant. This was a time when those lucky enough to pass a rigorous interview and then win a lottery were able to give birth at the British Lying-In Hospital, thus helping ensure their children got a better start in life. programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: On the wild north Atlantic coast, Rick heads out to sea to go fishing for lobsters with his old friend and celebrity chef Nathan Outlaw, before helping to cook up a lobster risotto. Later, at Tresillian House near Newquay, Rick meets with head gardener John Harris to find out more about his Victorian walled garden

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Robson invites TV presenter Steph McGovern on a journey around Northumberland. They search for ingredients for dinner with the help of a beach foraging expert, harness the wind to try their hands at kite buggying here they enjoy beach foraging, kite buggying and go looking for tiny wildlife on a bug safari

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A young married couple seek to escape London's Docklands and move to the Chiltern Hills of Buckinghamshire. Guided by Ginny Buckley, and with a healthy budget of 850,000, they want to realise their dream of raising their family with more room inside and more green space outside. The property search happens to fall in the same week as the Henley Regatta, where Ginny gets behind the scenes with rowing royalty at this famous societal sporting event

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Leonard and Cristina's garden in Birmingham doesn't get much sun and has an awkward slope right in the middle. Designers Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill both think they have the answer - and go head to head to persuade the pair in invest their 3,000 budget in their respective visions of the ideal multi-functional family garden

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Tim Medhurst's antique trail takes them to the Isle of Man, where Tim picks up a captain's chair, a pair of bears, a bronzed sculpture of a footballer, while Margie plays it safer with a bargain antique corkscrew, as well as a cocktail shaker and a sewing machine

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Konnie Huq

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and Alex Jones round off the working week with the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey decides to tell Martin what happens during her secret cam dates so he fully understands, but Theo overhears and is angry that they presume he must be a sad, old man. Kim and Howie fall out over her plans to talk about mental health online. Freddie encourages a dejected Alfie to use the power of positive thinking

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team bring three treasured family heirlooms - and the memories they hold - back to life. Stephen Kember mends a cherished but sadly long mute music box. Bequeathed to Betty Hill by her beloved father, a professional stage magician, this miniature item presents an exacting undertaking for the restorer. A much-loved pushalong horse, and revive a water-damaged penny arcade game are also rejuvenated

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: The lives of staff and players inside Judges Bingo hall in Tonypandy. Local midwives Lucy, Ruth, Jade and Hayley arrive, hoping to land the jackpot. Also with an eye also on the 50,000 prize fund are grief support workers, Jody and Kyle. Engaged for 16 years, a good result today would be to walk away with a date in the diary for Jody's dream wedding. The icing on the possible wedding cake would be a big win that pays for it. Regulars Kath and Helen are also focused on a big number - Kath's 75th birthday

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe presents the grand final, with judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young kicking things off by challenging the sewers to make a Victoriana-style evening dress. These dresses require delicate fabrics to create the glamorous effect, but they are tricky to handle. Next, it's the sewers' last chance to show off their instinct for design in the transformation challenge, as they attempt to turn female party wear into a glamorous men's red-carpet outfit. Finally, they fit a Met Gala-worthy 'two-in-one' dress for their models, who this week are a friend or family member

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Firebombers
programme.desc: Part one of two. In 1979, four holiday homes in Wales were torched in one night. This marked the beginning of an arson campaign targeting second homes owned by English people, whom the attackers claimed were destroying Welsh culture because of their part-time presence. Over the next decade, more than 200 homes and businesses were attacked by a secret organisation known as Meibion Glyndwr

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Comedy about a young aspiring film-maker trapped in a recruitment job. When Kwabena bumps into an old friend from film school who is now working at a production company, he gets the chance that he has been waiting for. Unfortunately, she fixes him a once-in-a-lifetime pitching opportunity that clashes with a career-saving presentation - forcing him to choose between going all in or giving up his dream entirely. Co-written by and starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena moonlights as a food delivery driver to finance his film, but feels his new job makes him beneath Vanessa, so he struggles to keep it a secret. Things start to look up when he is hired by Funmi to film her eccentric aunt's 60th birthday party, and gets an intriguing tip from an old film school friend. Amy pushes for a promotion at work, and Maurice is anxious about fatherhood. Guest starring Peter Serafinowicz and Jo Martin

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: USA v Netherlands (Kick-off 2.00am). All the action from the Group E encounter at Wellington Regional Stadium in New Zealand, as both teams play their second match. This is a repeat of the 2019 final, which the Americans won 2-0 in France. Reshmin Chowdhury presents, with analysis from Anita Asante and Fern Williams, and commentary by Steve Wyeth and Fara Williams

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: The stories of beat coppers who stumble upon a key piece of evidence and bring a major criminal to justice. A car running a red light leads officers into a chase with an armed criminal, and a suspicious death leads to the discovery of a deadly poison plot. Presented by Ramon Tikaram

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble meets a giraffe whose weight-loss could mean a crisis for the whole herd, while Ben Fogle finds out which eucalyptus leaves koalas like best and Jean Johansson serves up some refreshing fish lollies for the tigers

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell, Dion Dubllin and Tommy Walsh explore properties in Brixton, south London, Chesterton in Staffordshire and Chelmsford, Essex, and ask the buyers about their plans

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the show from Epsom in Surrey, and hails a hackney cabs to take him across London. The Reds and the Blues are led by Thomas Forrester and Gary Pe

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick journeys inland from the majestic Camel Estuary to one of Britain's finest vineyards, where he joins in harvesting the grapes to discover that the Cornish weather is perfect making some of the best wine in the country. Just off Pentire Point, as the sun sets, Rick rides the gentle swell of the north Atlantic with an old friend, casting his line to hook Britain's fastest fish, before firing up the barbecue to cook his catch with a recipe inspired from a trip to Goa. Rick joins Tim Smit, best known for starting the hugely successful Eden Project, who reveals to Rick his new and ambitious idea in Cornwall

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Businesswoman and Dragons' Den star Sara Davies takes Robson gorge-walking in Teesdale to introduce him to her way of getting close to nature. After overnighting in a shepherd's hut on a cheese farm, Robson heads to nearby Barnard Castle before visiting the nearby Raby country estate

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps an animal-loving house hunter from Oxfordshire to find a village property in Dorset, ideally close to the coast, and also visits a luxury yacht manufacturer

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam are in Stotfold, Bedfordshire, to create a colourful, peaceful retreat for Daniel and Saleha. The couple are both sun worshippers and would like colour and drama incorporated into the design, as well as a water feature, while Saleha has also asked for some nods to her Bangladeshi heritage

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Tim Medhurst explore Cumbria in a campervan, picking up a Scots Guards picture, a rare Scottish jug, and some silver jewellery

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Konnie Huq in the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Distraught Keanu desperately seeks ways to get Peggy back but is heartbroken to discover that a legal battle through the Portuguese courts could take years. Stacey plans a romantic rendezvous at the allotments with Martin, only to realise she has double booked with her client. Kathy is fuming at the knowledge Suki will be going on her honeymoon after Rocky lost it in a poker game to Nish, and Howie gives Kim a pep talk

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Painter Jemisha Maadhavji creates artwork of junior doctor Grace, who sustained a life-altering spinal cord injury during her studies when a man jumped from a third-floor balcony and landed on her. She discusses how using a wheelchair can be an advantage in her work in a busy London A&E department, as it places her at eye level to patients in their beds, allowing her to better connect with them

programme.title: The Sixth Commandment
programme.desc: The true picture comes to light when Thames Valley Police open an investigation. The police trawl through evidence and make a connection between Peter's and Ann's symptoms. They have a working hypothesis, but what they desperately need is proof. Evidence starts to pile up and the police soon realise that they could be dealing with a frighteningly complex and calculating criminal mind

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: We Hunt Together
programme.desc: Freddy's dark history surfaces as she and Baba don Halloween masks to gain entry to her old school. Jackson and Lola find evidence that links the pair to the third victim, but will they join the dots in time to save a fourth? Psychological thriller, starring Eve Myles and Babou Ceesay

programme.title: Ordinary Love (2019)
programme.desc: When loving wife Joan feels a lump in her breast, she and husband Tom attempt to navigate the world of serious illness, including the surgery, radiation and chemotherapy. Lisa Barros D'Sa and Glenn Leyburn's critically acclaimed drama based on a script by playwright Owen McCafferty, starring Lesley Manville, Liam Neeson and Esh Alladi

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Colombia v Korea Republic (Kick-off 3.00am). All the action from both teams' opening match in Group H, held at Sydney Football Stadium in Australia. Colombia last appeared in this tournament in 2015, when they reached the last 16, while the Koreans were eliminated in the group stage four years ago. With commentary by Vicki Sparks and Karen Bardsley

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: A police officer's instinct leads to armed robbers being caught in the act and a dangerous driver turns out to be a big-time drug dealer

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Cheetahs and endangered spiders both enter mating season. A Bactrian camel undergoes laser treatment, and a party is thrown to celebrate the ninth birthday of AJ the red panda

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The team visits a three bed mid terrace property in Derby, a split level two bed flat in Southend on Sea, and a three bed mid terrace in Ebbw Vale, South Wales

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Roo Irvine hosts from Southwell Racecourse, Nottinghamshire, where experts Izzie Balmer and Nick Hall provide advice for the teams seeking to find items of value to take to auction. Plus, Roo learns about wartime surgeons at National Civil War Centre

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the Fowey Estuary, one of Cornwall's hidden secrets, joining a friend on a boat trip to learn about the history of the area and getting a unique view of the buildings along the riverbank. He discovers the area's history of piracy, meets a family that make award-winning vodka, and makes a pancake with a wild blackberry compote and Cornish clotted cream

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Robson and his Grantchester co-star Tom Brittney take a road trip around County Durham, where they go dragonboat racing on the Wear a journey on the oldest railway in the world at Tanfield. They also spend a night in a forest camp, where they forage for food, enjoy a campfire sing-song and a sleep in self-erected hammocks

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps an aspiring writer who wants to make a dramatic relocation from the frenetic bustle of east London to the rural idylls of Dumfries and Galloway in Scotland. With a budget of 300,000, he has his sights set on somewhere isolated that will inspire his creativity. Away from the houses, Alistair heads for the hills hoping to strike it lucky on a Scottish gold rush

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: In Swindon, Catherine is recovering from multiple brain surgeries and wants a garden in which to relax and recuperate. She would like its design to reflect the period character of her Victorian terraced property and has a budget of 3,000 to achieve this. Designers Chris Hull and Lee Burkhill rise to the challenge, with both having peace and calm at the core of their proposed schemes

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Tim Medhurst tour the Lake District looking for bargains, picking up a French carriage clock, a Chinese pepperette and a Derbyshire candlestick

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Konnie Huq

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: River City
programme.desc: Poppy's lies about her gambling addiction put her under pressure from Sam, while Nicole becomes frustrated at being side-lined by both Tyler and Alex. Elsewhere, Maggie convinces Lou to help her get back in the driving seat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: After talking to Jean, Martin resolves to come to terms with Stacey's cam work and the two go out for dinner - but it soon becomes clear he is far from happy. Howie tries to persuade Kim to log off so she can go to her therapy appointment, while the stakes get high for Suki and Kathy

programme.title: What They Really Mean For You
programme.desc: Michelle Ackerley presents the first of two programmes exploring aspects of modern life that need to change to protect the environment, which focuses on the switch to electric cars. The programme explores the obstacles in electric vehicles becoming the standard, from cost to the difficulty of charging, while BBC Climate Editor Justin Rowlatt explores if the UK is on track to hit the government's targets to stop emitting greenhouse gases by 2050

programme.title: The Sixth Commandment
programme.desc: Ben Field stands trial for Peter Farquhar's murder and conspiring to murder Ann Moore-Martin. After a long day in court, tensions rise between Ann-Marie and Simon as the press swarm, while Ben remains unflappable in the face of cross-examination. As the final day dawns, the hunt is on for the final piece of the puzzle that can prove murder was committed

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Comedian Chris Ramsey researches his family tree, starting by investigating his great grandfather who fought in the First World War. A trip to the military base in Dorset where he trained, reveals he fought at Gallipoli, one of the deadliest campaigns of the conflict. Tracing back to the late 18th century, Chris revisits the era when his five-times great grandmother was pregnant. This was a time when those lucky enough to pass a rigorous interview and then win a lottery were able to give birth at the British Lying-In Hospital, thus helping ensure their children got a better start in life. Narrated by Phil Davis

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: An '80s 'mean girl' ghost named Stephanie, who died on her prom night, is awakened in the attic, triggering Sam to confront what happened on her own prom night

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: Jay and Sam are ready to open their bed-and-breakfast, unleashing a horde of bored ghosts on unsuspecting guests - but Thor's pettiness comes back to bite them

programme.title: The Edit
programme.desc: The best of the week's entertainment news, presented by Amy Irons and David Farrell

programme.desc: The simple stop and search of a suspicious man leads to the arrest of a serial killer and a police officer's instinct leads to an armed stand-off in an isolated beauty spot. Plus, a road traffic collision leads to the discovery of a massive fraud with thousands of victims

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble meets a young zebra in crisis, Ben Fogle plays Sherlock Holmes to find escaped porcupines, and Jean Johansson learns what happens when a lion comes face to face with itself

programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from Detling, and challenges people to guess what an unusual gadget is for. Thomas Forrester and Ochuko Ojiri assist the teams
