Lisa Barros D'Sa and Glenn Leyburn's critically acclaimed drama based on a script by playwright Owen McCafferty, starring Lesley Manville, Liam Neeson and Esh Alladi

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Colombia v Korea Republic (Kick-off 3.00am). All the action from both teams' opening match in Group H, held at Sydney Football Stadium in Australia. Colombia last appeared in this tournament in 2015, when they reached the last 16, while the Koreans were eliminated in the group stage four years ago. With commentary by Vicki Sparks and Karen Bardsley

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: A police officer's instinct leads to armed robbers being caught in the act and a dangerous driver turns out to be a big-time drug dealer

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Cheetahs and endangered spiders both enter mating season. A Bactrian camel undergoes laser treatment, and a party is thrown to celebrate the ninth birthday of AJ the red panda

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The team visits a three bed mid terrace property in Derby, a split level two bed flat in Southend on Sea, and a three bed mid terrace in Ebbw Vale, South Wales

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Roo Irvine hosts from Southwell Racecourse, Nottinghamshire, where experts Izzie Balmer and Nick Hall provide advice for the teams seeking to find items of value to take to auction. Plus, Roo learns about wartime surgeons at National Civil War Centre

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the Fowey Estuary, one of Cornwall's hidden secrets, joining a friend on a boat trip to learn about the history of the area and getting a unique view of the buildings along the riverbank. He discovers the area's history of piracy, meets a family that make award-winning vodka, and makes a pancake with a wild blackberry compote and Cornish clotted cream

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Robson and his Grantchester co-star Tom Brittney take a road trip around County Durham, where they go dragonboat racing on the Wear a journey on the oldest railway in the world at Tanfield. They also spend a night in a forest camp, where they forage for food, enjoy a campfire sing-song and a sleep in self-erected hammocks

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps an aspiring writer who wants to make a dramatic relocation from the frenetic bustle of east London to the rural idylls of Dumfries and Galloway in Scotland. With a budget of 300,000, he has his sights set on somewhere isolated that will inspire his creativity. Away from the houses, Alistair heads for the hills hoping to strike it lucky on a Scottish gold rush

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: In Swindon, Catherine is recovering from multiple brain surgeries and wants a garden in which to relax and recuperate. She would like its design to reflect the period character of her Victorian terraced property and has a budget of 3,000 to achieve this. Designers Chris Hull and Lee Burkhill rise to the challenge, with both having peace and calm at the core of their proposed schemes

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Tim Medhurst tour the Lake District looking for bargains, picking up a French carriage clock, a Chinese pepperette and a Derbyshire candlestick

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Konnie Huq

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Vick Hope and Jermaine Jenas present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: After talking to Jean, Martin resolves to come to terms with Stacey's cam work and the two go out for dinner - but it soon becomes clear he is far from happy. Howie tries to persuade Kim to log off so she can go to her therapy appointment, while the stakes get high for Suki and Kathy

programme.title: What They Really Mean For You
programme.desc: Michelle Ackerley presents the first of two programmes exploring aspects of modern life that need to change to protect the environment, which focuses on the switch to electric cars. The programme explores the obstacles in electric vehicles becoming the standard, from cost to the difficulty of charging, while BBC Climate Editor Justin Rowlatt explores if the UK is on track to hit the government's targets to stop emitting greenhouse gases by 2050

programme.title: The Sixth Commandment
programme.desc: Ben Field stands trial for Peter Farquhar's murder and conspiring to murder Ann Moore-Martin. After a long day in court, tensions rise between Ann-Marie and Simon as the press swarm, while Ben remains unflappable in the face of cross-examination. As the final day dawns, the hunt is on for the final piece of the puzzle that can prove murder was committed

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Comedian Chris Ramsey researches his family tree, starting by investigating his great grandfather who fought in the First World War. A trip to the military base in Dorset where he trained, reveals he fought at Gallipoli, one of the deadliest campaigns of the conflict. Tracing back to the late 18th century, Chris revisits the era when his five-times great grandmother was pregnant. This was a time when those lucky enough to pass a rigorous interview and then win a lottery were able to give birth at the British Lying-In Hospital, thus helping ensure their children got a better start in life. Narrated by Phil Davis

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: An '80s 'mean girl' ghost named Stephanie, who died on her prom night, is awakened in the attic, triggering Sam to confront what happened on her own prom night

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: Jay and Sam are ready to open their bed-and-breakfast, unleashing a horde of bored ghosts on unsuspecting guests - but Thor's pettiness comes back to bite them

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: The simple stop and search of a suspicious man leads to the arrest of a serial killer and a police officer's instinct leads to an armed stand-off in an isolated beauty spot. Plus, a road traffic collision leads to the discovery of a massive fraud with thousands of victims

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble meets a young zebra in crisis, Ben Fogle plays Sherlock Holmes to find escaped porcupines, and Jean Johansson learns what happens when a lion comes face to face with itself

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and a four-legged friend visit a semi-detached house in Swansea, and Martel Maxwell explores a terrace in Bishop Auckland, Co Durham. Plus, news on a plot of land in Bolton, Lancashire, first featured in 2019

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from Detling, and challenges people to guess what an unusual gadget is for. Thomas Forrester and Ochuko Ojiri assist the teams

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: On the wild north Atlantic coast, Rick heads out to sea to go fishing for lobsters with his old friend and celebrity chef Nathan Outlaw, before helping to cook up a lobster risotto. Later, at Tresillian House near Newquay, Rick meets with head gardener John Harris to find out more about his Victorian walled garden

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Robson invites TV presenter Steph McGovern on a journey around Northumberland. They search for ingredients for dinner with the help of a beach foraging expert, harness the wind to try their hands at kite buggying here they enjoy beach foraging, kite buggying and go looking for tiny wildlife on a bug safari

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A young married couple seek to escape London's Docklands and move to the Chiltern Hills of Buckinghamshire. Guided by Ginny Buckley, and with a healthy budget of 850,000, they want to realise their dream of raising their family with more room inside and more green space outside. The property search happens to fall in the same week as the Henley Regatta, where Ginny gets behind the scenes with rowing royalty at this famous societal sporting event

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Leonard and Cristina's garden in Birmingham doesn't get much sun and has an awkward slope right in the middle. Designers Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill both think they have the answer - and go head to head to persuade the pair in invest their 3,000 budget in their respective visions of the ideal multi-functional family garden

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Tim Medhurst's antique trail takes them to the Isle of Man, where Tim picks up a captain's chair, a pair of bears, a bronzed sculpture of a footballer, while Margie plays it safer with a bargain antique corkscrew, as well as a cocktail shaker and a sewing machine

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Konnie Huq

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and Alex Jones round off the working week with the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey decides to tell Martin what happens during her secret cam dates so he fully understands, but Theo overhears and is angry that they presume he must be a sad, old man. Kim and Howie fall out over her plans to talk about mental health online. Freddie encourages a dejected Alfie to use the power of positive thinking

programme.title: Barra's Return of the Wild
programme.desc: Barra Best hears from the passionate individuals helping species and environments under threat. He meets the team investigating the promising possibility a slippery substance found in plentiful supply around the country's coast could help reduce the methane output of cows - a major agricultural source of greenhouse gases. Plus, a deep dive below the surface of a German lake to view the spectacular natural miracle being aided by a group of volunteers and how the moose's turn as an unlikely Swedish reality TV star is helping shine a light on the species' plight

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Painter Jemisha Maadhavji creates artwork of junior doctor Grace, who sustained a life-altering spinal cord injury during her studies when a man jumped from a third-floor balcony and landed on her. She discusses how using a wheelchair can be an advantage in her work in a busy London A&E department, as it places her at eye level to patients in their beds, allowing her to better connect with them

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe presents the grand final, with judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young kicking things off by challenging the sewers to make a Victoriana-style evening dress. These dresses require delicate fabrics to create the glamorous effect, but they are tricky to handle. Next, it's the sewers' last chance to show off their instinct for design in the transformation challenge, as they attempt to turn female party wear into a glamorous men's red-carpet outfit. Finally, they fit a Met Gala-worthy 'two-in-one' dress for their models, who this week are a friend or family member

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Ulster By the Sea
programme.desc: Further tales from the world of caravanners and caravanning across Northern Ireland, including Jim, who has been heading to Millisle every summer since he was a young child, and a group of teenagers who get to enjoy carefree days at the caravan that are hard to find at home in Belfast. Terry and Linda are a retired couple with a caravan in Ballycastle at one of the country's newest caravan parks and, with their working lives behind them, they give thanks for being able to do exactly as they please there

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Comedy about a young aspiring film-maker trapped in a recruitment job. When Kwabena bumps into an old friend from film school who is now working at a production company, he gets the chance that he has been waiting for. Unfortunately, she fixes him a once-in-a-lifetime pitching opportunity that clashes with a career-saving presentation - forcing him to choose between going all in or giving up his dream entirely. Co-written by and starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena moonlights as a food delivery driver to finance his film, but feels his new job makes him beneath Vanessa, so he struggles to keep it a secret. Things start to look up when he is hired by Funmi to film her eccentric aunt's 60th birthday party, and gets an intriguing tip from an old film school friend. Amy pushes for a promotion at work, and Maurice is anxious about fatherhood. Guest starring Peter Serafinowicz and Jo Martin

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Footballer Troy Deeney, heavyweight boxer Joe Joyce, mixed martial arts star Tom Aspinall, and World Champion swimmer Hannah Miley join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: USA v Netherlands (Kick-off 2.00am). All the action from the Group E encounter at Wellington Regional Stadium in New Zealand, as both teams play their second match. This is a repeat of the 2019 final, which the Americans won 2-0 in France. Reshmin Chowdhury presents, with analysis from Anita Asante and Fern Williams, and commentary by Steve Wyeth and Fara Williams

programme.title: Select Committees
programme.desc: The Justice select committee session on the work of the Lord Chancellor and Justice Secretary, with evidence from Alex Chalk, who took the role after the resignation of Dominic Raab, from Tuesday 18 July.

programme.title: This Cultural Life
programme.desc: John Wilson talks to Margaret Atwood, who traces her writing back to sagas that she invented with her brother as a child. programme.desc: Italy v Argentina (Kick-off 7.00am). All the action from both teams' opening match in Group G, held at Eden Park in Auckland, New Zealand. programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Brazil v Panama (Kick-off 12.00pm). All the action from both teams's first match in Group F, held at Hindmarsh Stadium in Adelaide, Australia. Despite all their success in the men's game, Brazil are yet to lift this trophy and have only reached the final once, when they were defeated by Germany in 2005. However, they will expect to overcome Panama, who are making their World Cup finals debut. Laura Woods presents, with analysis from Karen Carney, and commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Little Heroes
programme.desc: Paul meets energetic five-year-old Cora, who has cerebral palsy. To try to improve her co-ordination and muscle control, Cora is having Botox injections in her leg as part of a pioneering research trial. The presenter also chats to 10-year-old George, who is at the hospital for the latest round of laser surgery to lessen his facial birthmarks, and hears about three-month-old Oliver, who was born with a cleft lip. Oliver is just one of 6,000 babies treated at Great Ormond Street every year, so Paul also meets the special team dedicated to meeting the feeding demands of all those hungry little mouths

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team go to Folkestone to create a sensory garden full of fun features for a five-year-old girl with a rare form of severe epilepsy. The quirky design incorporates a circular seating area with a vintage fireplace as a focal point, and uses special planting to bring the area to life

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host the celebrity cookery series. This time, Joanna Page, Samia Longchambon and Claire Richards and their mentors take on the best of British as they battle to stay in the competition

programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: On Assignment
programme.desc: Rohit Kachroo travels to East London and finds a grieving community still seeking answers in the wake of the deaths of 21 teenagers in a South African nightclub. Ellie Pitt examines a new Spanish law that requires employers to give paid 'menstrual leave' to women who suffer from disabling periods, and Amy Lewis travels to Slovenia to explore how the country is trying to shake off its past

programme.title: Murder in the Family
programme.desc: Builder and father-of-two Kieran set fire to his mother-in-law in an ultimate act of hatred against his wife Susan. But what caused this horrendous spiral of violence, and what could have been done to avoid it? Using text messages, 999 call recordings, archive footage, and interviews with friends, family, the police and Susan herself, this film looks at the downward spiral of coercive control, domestic violence and drug abuse that led to a horrifying and tragic murder

programme.title: The Clinic
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of the rise and fall of the Tavistock Centre's Gender Identity Development Service (GIDS), now one of the most controversial units in the NHS. Through the powerful testimony of insiders and patients, this film from the Exposure strand provides a vivid insight into what led to its closure amid a continuing and highly charged debate around gender identity in the UK

programme.title: Karen Carney's Leaders of the Pack
programme.desc: The former England international shines a light on female footballers, beginning with Manchester United midfielder Katie Zelem as she prepares to travel to her first World Cup in Australia and New Zealand

programme.title: Winning Combination
programme.desc: Quiz, hosted by Omid Djalili, in which contestants Jess, Harry, Martin, Punita, Andy, Kate, Helen, Terry and Lee are assigned a number between one and nine. They are then whittled down to a final four, and the combination of numbers they are assigned represents the size of the jackpot they play to win in a final round

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Host Sanjeev Bhaskar invites four contestants to accumulate big cash totals by answering super quick-fire easy money questions. However, in order to take home that cash, they must survive The Switch, a series of three super hard multiple-choice questions that each has only one incorrect choice

programme.title: The Hajj: A Journey Through Mecca
programme.desc: Shehab Khan observes the ritual of the Hajj pilgrimage to Mecca in Saudi Arabia, as around two million Muslims from around the globe attend the six-day event. Sharing personal experiences and reflections, Shehab explores the historical context of the journey and its origins, joining pilgrims as they circle the Kaaba seven times, walk between mountains, pray together and throw stones at 'Satan' - before sleeping under open sky in the desert

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.desc: Stephen Fry looks at the impact of summer in the northern hemisphere and winter in the south, revealing that wildlife faces feast, famine, fire and torrential rain in different regions around the world. On Marion Island life has frozen to a standstill, with king penguin chicks facing starvation as their parents left months ago, while in northern Australia it's the dry season, and hooded parrots raise their chicks in termite mounds

programme.desc: Japan v Costa Rica (Kick-off 6.00am). Live coverage of both teams' second match in Group C, held at Dunedin Stadium in New Zealand. Japan are former champions and will expect to take the three points this morning. With commentary by Tom Gayle and Siobhan Chamberlain

programme.title: Catchphrase

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Sarah discovers her paternity test letter in Stephen's flat, Amy accuses Courtney of toying with Aadi, Paul introduces Shelly to Billy, and Todd's hope of a pay rise evaporates

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Spice Trail Adventure
programme.desc: The last leg of Joanna Lumley's journey takes her by dhow to Zanzibar, the spice island of Africa where merchants from around the world have left their mark on the architecture, religion and music. Finally, she travels to Jordan where the spice trail continued on land. She explores the vast plains of Wadi Rum from the back of a camel, meets one of the last nomadic Bedouin families and visits Za'atari refugee camp, home to Jordan's newest arrivals. Her journey ends at the one of the great wonders of the world, the ancient city of Petra

programme.title: 22 Jump Street (2014)
programme.desc: Undercover cops Schmidt and Jenko are sent on a new assignment at a university. When one joins the college American football team and the other falls in with a crowd of Bohemian artists, loyalty to their new cliques puts a strain on their friendship. Crime comedy, starring Jonah Hill and Channing Tatum

programme.title: Exposure
programme.desc: This intimate documentary follows the story of one woman's extraordinary struggle over five years to bring the man who raped her to justice - a man accused of scores of assaults and rapes against women who applied for work at his London escort agency. The film follows 'Sam', with complete access to her story - from revealing her rape, through 18 months in a safe house and botched police investigations, to her discovery of other victims and crucial evidence

programme.title: Winning Combination
programme.desc: Omid Djalili hosts the quiz show in which contestants use their wits to get through to the final, where the combination of numbers they are assigned represents the amount of money they play for. Which of today's nine - Brett, Jamal, Nicky, Billy, Faye, Fadekemi, Karen, Lee and Chris - will be playing for the jackpot?

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: As a population we're living longer than ever before, but the years we're adding to our lives aren't necessarily the healthiest. In the UK, people are living on average 12 years in poor health - 14 per cent longer than in 1990. But what can we do to stop that? In the second of two Tonight programmes looking at healthy ageing, journalist Kate Quilton looks at the impact our diet can have on our later years

programme.title: Next Level Chef
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay, Paul Ainsworth and Nyesha Arrington front the culinary challenge which sees a mixture of home cooks and professional chefs competing across a three-storey kitchen. This week the contestants go Italian - but the kitchen in which each of them works, from the swanky top floor to the dingy basement, depends on how well they did last week

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott is joined by chef Jeremy Pang and Strictly Come Dancing's Anton Du Beke to rustle up some warming winter dishes, including a hearty beef and red pea stew with thyme spinner dumplings, warm mulled cider, sweet and spicy nuts, and tropical rum crumble with nutmeg custard. Anton serves up rum and raisin bread and butter pudding, while Jeremy Pang shares his lamb rendang recipe

programme.title: Gino's Italian Family Adventure
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo and his son Rocco head to bustling Naples for a trip down memory lane. They also discover the incredible street food the city has to offer, and Gino cooks up one of his mother's favourite recipes

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Italy v Argentina (Kick-off 7.00am). All the action from both teams' opening match in Group G, held at Eden Park in Auckland, New Zealand. programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Brazil v Panama (Kick-off 12.00pm). All the action from both teams's first match in Group F, held at Hindmarsh Stadium in Adelaide, Australia. Despite all their success in the men's game, Brazil are yet to lift this trophy and have only reached the final once, when they were defeated by Germany in 2005. However, they will expect to overcome Panama, who are making their World Cup finals debut. Laura Woods presents, with analysis from Karen Carney, and commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Bob's anger starts to rise. Arthur interferes with Rishi and Jai. Charles is troubled

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Little Heroes
programme.desc: Paul meets energetic five-year-old Cora, who has cerebral palsy. To try to improve her co-ordination and muscle control, Cora is having Botox injections in her leg as part of a pioneering research trial. The presenter also chats to 10-year-old George, who is at the hospital for the latest round of laser surgery to lessen his facial birthmarks, and hears about three-month-old Oliver, who was born with a cleft lip. Oliver is just one of 6,000 babies treated at Great Ormond Street every year, so Paul also meets the special team dedicated to meeting the feeding demands of all those hungry little mouths

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team go to Folkestone to create a sensory garden full of fun features for a five-year-old girl with a rare form of severe epilepsy. The quirky design incorporates a circular seating area with a vintage fireplace as a focal point, and uses special planting to bring the area to life

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host the celebrity cookery series. This time, Joanna Page, Samia Longchambon and Claire Richards and their mentors take on the best of British as they battle to stay in the competition

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: On Assignment
programme.desc: Rohit Kachroo travels to East London and finds a grieving community still seeking answers in the wake of the deaths of 21 teenagers in a South African nightclub. Ellie Pitt examines a new Spanish law that requires employers to give paid 'menstrual leave' to women who suffer from disabling periods, and Amy Lewis travels to Slovenia to explore how the country is trying to shake off its past

programme.title: Murder in the Family
programme.desc: Builder and father-of-two Kieran set fire to his mother-in-law in an ultimate act of hatred against his wife Susan. But what caused this horrendous spiral of violence, and what could have been done to avoid it? Using text messages, 999 call recordings, archive footage, and interviews with friends, family, the police and Susan herself, this film looks at the downward spiral of coercive control, domestic violence and drug abuse that led to a horrifying and tragic murder

programme.title: The Clinic
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of the rise and fall of the Tavistock Centre's Gender Identity Development Service (GIDS), now one of the most controversial units in the NHS. Through the powerful testimony of insiders and patients, this film from the Exposure strand provides a vivid insight into what led to its closure amid a continuing and highly charged debate around gender identity in the UK

programme.title: Karen Carney's Leaders of the Pack
programme.desc: The former England international shines a light on female footballers, beginning with Manchester United midfielder Katie Zelem as she prepares to travel to her first World Cup in Australia and New Zealand

programme.title: Winning Combination
programme.desc: Quiz, hosted by Omid Djalili, in which contestants Jess, Harry, Martin, Punita, Andy, Kate, Helen, Terry and Lee are assigned a number between one and nine. They are then whittled down to a final four, and the combination of numbers they are assigned represents the size of the jackpot they play to win in a final round

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Host Sanjeev Bhaskar invites four contestants to accumulate big cash totals by answering super quick-fire easy money questions. However, in order to take home that cash, they must survive The Switch, a series of three super hard multiple-choice questions that each has only one incorrect choice

programme.title: The Hajj: A Journey Through Mecca
programme.desc: Shehab Khan observes the ritual of the Hajj pilgrimage to Mecca in Saudi Arabia, as around two million Muslims from around the globe attend the six-day event. Sharing personal experiences and reflections, Shehab explores the historical context of the journey and its origins, joining pilgrims as they circle the Kaaba seven times, walk between mountains, pray together and throw stones at 'Satan' - before sleeping under open sky in the desert

programme.title: Chuck

programme.desc: Nathan becomes increasingly annoyed with Clay, causing a rift between Haley and Quinn, while Brooke tells Julian about her concerns over his growing connection with Alex. Millicent's drug problem worsens and Skills starts a new career in Los Angeles

programme.title: Dawson's Creek
programme.desc: As the gang prepare for a Valentine's Day party, Jack's ex-girlfriend arrives in town, so Pacey persuades Dawson to catch her on the rebound - and Joey reluctantly agrees to help. Meanwhile, Jen's first date with Henry proves unforgettable for all the wrong reasons

programme.title: Dinner Date

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: The employees are all struck down with food poisoning, although Amy suspects her sickness might be for other reasons. Meanwhile, Glenn has a bad trip to the pharmacy

Noakes advises Steve to keep well away as it is not technically a police matter, but the officer decides to investigate further. Rural drama, starring Trevor Ray, Georgie Glen and James Carlton

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Vernon buys a batch of topsoil for his new compost-producing business, little suspecting it is from a contaminated landfill site. The shady dealer who sold him the soil winds up dead - as do a number of local cows - and Vernon is soon fighting for his life. programme.desc: Another chance to see the feature-length first episode of the popular detective drama. Inspector Jack Frost's investigation into the case of a missing child uncovers a skeleton chained to a locked strongbox that tantalisingly turns out to be empty, but provides evidence of a crime committed 30 years previously. programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: The detective investigates the disappearance of a Dutch au pair, which seems connected to rivalry amid the city's academics. His search leads him to a family estate in the Oxfordshire countryside where he meets three siblings divided by personal demons and shared loss. Endeavour suspects there is a link between the disappearance and an unsolved case from years before, but as the investigation continues, conflict erupts between his fellow officers. When a group of teenagers makes a horrifying discovery, he suspects someone is manipulating events from afar

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: When a toddler goes missing from a high-street merry-go-round, his distraught mother reports him kidnapped and a massive police hunt is launched to track him down. However, with more than one suspect and no physical evidence, the search throws up more questions than answers - especially as the boy's mum seems to be hiding something. Crime drama, starring Bradley Walsh and Jamie Bamber

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Crime drama, starring Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar as detectives investigating a cold-case killing from almost 40 years earlier. The discovery of a skeleton in the cellar of a demolished building launches a murder hunt, headed up by DCI Cassie Stuart and DS Sunny Khan. However, all they have to go on is a car key found near the body, which leads them on a search to find out who he is, as well as how, when and why he died. WithTom Courtenay, Trevor Eve, Bernard Hill, Ruth Sheen, Gemma Jones and Hannah Gordon

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Having identified the body in the cellar as Jimmy Sullivan, Cassie visits the victim's mother, who is relieved that she might finally find out what happened to her son 39 years after he went missing. The detectives focus their investigation on the names in Jimmy's diary, who are revealed to be a government advisor, a priest, a retired bookkeeper and a housewife with a secret past. What part, if any, could these four wildly different people have played in Jimmy's disappearance and demise? Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar star in the crime drama, with Tom Courtenay, Trevor Eve, Bernard Hill and Ruth Sheen

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.desc: When a body is dredged up from a slurry pit on a remote farm, the investigation forces owner Danny Pryor to admit he has a number of illegal Serbian workers on the payroll. A faded tattoo identifies the victim as Jack Reeves, a young man from the local travelling community, but what is his connection to the immigrants? As the case unfolds, Vera and her team must connect the dots between Jack and a wounded Serbian, and expose the tragic truth at the heart of Pryor Farm. With Mark Bonnar, Mark Womack and Jim Sturgeon

programme.desc: CGI-animated update of the classic children's cartoon from the 1980s. Meanwhile, Penny has also become an agent in training and now has Brain as her assistant - the Chief then calls Penny to meet Talon, who is the agency's new recruit, and she instantly falls in love with him.

programme.title: Inspector Gadget

Sandi shares a personal confession and the pair go for an icy dip in the North Atlantic. Next, the duo stay at the eco-resort Lough Mardal Lodge where they meet miniature cows and share stories of Mongolian princesses. programme.title: Chateau DIY

programme.desc: A night out ends badly when a young man is involved in a fight. programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: As the Thanksgiving holiday approaches, Mr Burns hires Homer to amuse him by playing pranks on all and sundry - a situation that upsets Lisa, who has all sorts of old-fashioned ideas about dignity being more important than money

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: Rosie Jones Am I a R*tard?
programme.desc: The comedian takes the opportunity to explore and educate viewers on the online abuse faced by those with disabilities, including herself as a person with cerebral palsy. She sets herself the challenge of confronting a troll directly, and explores the role that social media plays in the rise of this abuse. Rosie wants everyone in the UK to be made aware of ableism and to stand up to it when they see it and for everyone to play their part in ending the suffering of people who are abused simply because of their disability

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from Guernsey and Alderney compete for the 1,000 cash prize. Sophie and Turk begin the competition with a locally sourced menu, but dessert proves to be their downfall. programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to The Griffin Inn, in Irnham, Lincolnshire, where hosts Jamie and Leila Benton Jones invite the B&Bers to their very own village, steeped in history

programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to Crossroads House owned by Julie and Alistair Musgrave, who pride themselves on their full English fry-up and Cumberland banger. Jamie and Leila are surprised by the B&B's roadside location but impressed by their newly spick-and-span room, while Jill and Inez dig into the mismatched decor in theirs. At drinks, Julie and Alistair reveal their entrepreneurial ambitions and are confident their breakfast offering will bring home the win. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to trade feedback, starting with The Old Rose & Crown, where Jamie and Leila lay into the linen. Things take an emotional turn when Julie and Alistair chew over their bad breakfast score. There are harsh truths, heated debates and disagreements as the payments are revealed before the winner is finally announced

Once belonging to Roxy Music guitarist Paul Manzanera, it's an exciting listing for Amy who is on the hunt for a buyer willing to pay 5.45million or a tenant with 20,500 per month to spend. Mo entrusts Natalie with a new listing - an enormous three-storey converted factory in the heart of Spitalfields worth 2.3million. Featuring astonishing never-before-seen archive footage and dramatic reconstruction, this programme retraces the events that unfolded and his eventual demise

In the first episode, experts examine how Henry VIII's traumatic childhood affected his personality, from the death of his older brother to the tragic early death of his beloved mother. Narrated by Jason Isaacs

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts

He has a huge gash to the back on his head, but the medical staff are concerned he may have also seriously injured his neck and spine. Meanwhile, Advanced Nurse Practitioner Dave Sagol meets 61-year-old June, who has been rushed into the hospital with swollen legs and having difficulty breathing

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Henry VIII: Rise of a Tyrant
programme.desc: Three-part drama-documentary series revealing the truth about England's most infamous King, King Henry VIII. The second episode takes viewers on a journey through the turbulent marriages, affairs and tyrannical politics of King Henry VIII's reign, and explores how Henry's obsession with marrying Anne Boleyn resulted in a cataclysmic and hugely unpopular split with the Roman Catholic Church. The programme also examines Henry's relationship with his new chief advisor and enforcer, Thomas Cromwell, who would come to bear the brunt of the King's increasing unhinged behaviour in the years to come. Narrated by Jason Isaacs

programme.title: Alex Polizzi's Secret Italy
programme.desc: Alex begins the third leg of her journey in Naples, a busy and chaotic city with a population of around 960,000, and learns what it is like to live in the shadow of Vesuvius, the volcano that famously erupted in 79AD and destroyed the town of Pompeii. Alex then heads to the spectacular Amalfi coast, the destination for part of her honeymoon, and samples the cuisine at the Villa Cimbrone in Ravello, where chef Mamma Agata has catered for stars including Humphrey Bogart, Richard Burton, Liz Taylor and Fred Astaire

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The team treats an owl that refuses to fly and a badger with life-threatening injuries, while Simon tries to free a deer that has become stuck in railings

programme.title: House Doctor

programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Thomas & Friends

programme.title: Paw Patrol

programme.title: Coffee Morning Club
programme.desc: The members of the Deaf Club await their fate in holding cells at the police station

programme.title: The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie (2004)
programme.desc: The plucky sea creature sets out to prove his boss Mr Krabs is innocent of stealing Neptune's crown. However, the missing item has ended up in sinister Shell City, which all sea-dwellers fear and from which few have ever returned. Animated comedy, with the voices of Tom Kenny, Bill Fagerbakke, Clancy Brown and Scarlett Johansson, plus a cameo appearance by David Hasselhoff

programme.title: Little Monsters (1989)
programme.desc: Brian is a lonely 11-year-old who's just moved to Boston with his family. He's having a hard time making friends in his new neighbourhood, and to make matters worse, he wakes up one morning to find he's being blamed for a stack of pranks that he swears he hasn't done. However, a blue-skinned monster called Maurice soon changes his life forever. Comedy, starring Fred Savage, Howie Mandel and Daniel Stern

programme.title: Anne of the Indies (1951)
programme.desc: A no-nonsense pirate welcomes a French captain on board her ship and promptly falls in love - unaware the charming officer has been sent by the British to capture her. Learning of the deception, she kidnaps his wife to sell as a slave. Jacques Tourneur's high-seas adventure, starring Jean Peters, Louis Jourdan, Debra Paget and Herbert Marshall

programme.title: The Pink Panther (1963)
programme.desc: The world's most inept police detective, Inspector Clouseau, heads off to Switzerland in search of a suave jewel thief who has purloined a priceless diamond from a princess - but the bumbling officer's every ruse to foil the crime ends in chaos, not least when he is framed for the robbery himself. Blake Edwards' comedy, starring Peter Sellers, David Niven, Capucine, Robert Wagner and Claudia Cardinale

programme.title: Gods of Egypt (2016)
programme.desc: An ancient Egyptian god is driven into exile when his evil brother murders their father and seizes his throne. He enlists the aid of a human thief in restoring justice, and in return offers to help the mortal to bring his murdered lover back to life. Fantasy adventure, starring Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, Brenton Thwaites, Gerard Butler and Chadwick Boseman

programme.title: John Wick: Chapter 3 - Parabellum (2019)
programme.desc: The seemingly invincible hero returns, this time with a $14million bounty on his head which rises each hour, and every underworld figure around the world desperate to cash in. However, John Wick does receive support from Sofia, a fellow dog lover, assassin and manager of Casablanca's Continental Hotel. Director Chad Stahelski's action thriller sequel, starring Keanu Reeves, Halle Berry and Ian McShane

programme.title: Pixie (2020)
programme.desc: To avenge her mother's death, a young woman named Pixie masterminds a heist but must flee across Ireland from gangsters, take on the patriarchy, and choose her own destiny along the way. Crime comedy, starring Olivia Cooke, Fra Fee and Rory Fleck Byrne

programme.title: Skate Kitchen (2018)
programme.desc: Teenage skateboarder Camille's life as a lonely suburban teenager changes dramatically when she befriends a bunch of other skateboarding girls in New York City. As she journeys deeper into the city's subculture, she begins to understand the true meaning of friendship. Drama, starring Rachelle Vinberg, Dede Lovelace and Nina Moran

programme.title: Jingle All the Way (1996)
programme.desc: A workaholic father tries to make up for his perpetual absence from home by promising to buy his son a hugely popular action figure for Christmas - little realising every other father in town has the same idea. Comedy, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Sinbad, Jake Lloyd, Rita Wilson, Robert Conrad and Phil Hartman

programme.title: Angus, Thongs and Perfect Snogging (2008)
programme.desc: A 14-year-old girl struggles to cope with the torments of growing up, fitting in and finding a boyfriend. Tired of being a social outcast, she plans to throw the perfect birthday party to win the respect of her peers. Comedy drama based on Louise Rennison's series of novels, starring Georgia Groome, Alan Davies, Karen Taylor and Aaron Taylor-Johnson

programme.title: The Man in the White Suit (1951)
programme.desc: A put-upon chemist's invention of an indestructible dirt-proof fibre brings him into conflict with clothing industry moguls who foresee their profits disappearing down the drain - and promptly vow to put a stop to his plans. Satirical Ealing comedy, starring Alec Guinness, Joan Greenwood, Cecil Parker and Michael Gough

programme.title: We're No Angels (1955)
programme.desc: Three convicts escape from the penal colony on notorious Devil's Island and seize a French family's shop - only to find themselves helping the storekeeper outwit his scheming relatives. Comedy, starring Humphrey Bogart, Peter Ustinov, Aldo Ray and Basil Rathbone

programme.title: Instant Family (2018)
programme.desc: After being taunted by relatives who think they will never have kids, married couple Pete and Ellie Wagner consider the option of adopting a child. However, they get more than they bargained for when they take in a rebellious teen and her two siblings. Director Sean Anders' comedy, starring Mark Wahlberg, Rose Byrne and Isabela Merced

programme.title: Oppenheimer Interview Special
programme.desc: Cillian Murphy, Matt Damon, Emily Blunt and director Christopher Nolan talk about making the historical dramatic thriller about J. Robert Oppenheimer

programme.title: Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines (2003)
programme.desc: John Connor finds his destiny to lead the human race in a future war is catching up with him when an advanced new Terminator in female form is sent back in time to eliminate him. However, a reprogrammed cyborg has also been dispatched to act as his protector. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Nick Stahl, Claire Danes and Kristanna Loken

programme.title: Maze Runner: The Death Cure (2018)
programme.desc: A group of young people face their final battle with the sinister organisation that has been manipulating their lives. Together, they must venture into a deadly labyrinth in search of both their captive friends and a cure to the pandemic that has been devastating the world. However, when they discover the reason the prisoners are being kept, they face a terrible choice between saving their friends and the future of the human race. Final part of the sci-fi trilogy based on James Dashner's series of novels, starring Dylan O'Brien, Ki Hong Lee, Kaya Scodelario, Patricia Clarkson and Giancarlo Esposito

programme.title: It's Only the End of the World (2016)
programme.desc: After years away, a prize-winning dramatist returns to his home town to tell his family that he's dying. French-Canadian drama, starring Gaspard Ulliel, Nathalie Baye, Vincent Cassel, Marion Cotillard and Lea Seydoux. In French and English

programme.title: The Golden Voyage of Sinbad (1974)
programme.desc: A swashbuckling sailor stumbles across a golden tablet that forms part of a map revealing the way to a magic fountain, which is fabled to bestow untold riches and eternal youth. But first the brave mariner has to battle storms, monsters and the trickery of an evil wizard before he can reach his goal. Fantasy adventure, with John Phillip Law, Tom Baker, Douglas Wilmer, Martin Shaw and Caroline Munro, with effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: The Art of Racing in the Rain (2019)
programme.desc: Thanks to his race car driver owner, golden retriever Enzo learns that the techniques needed on the racetrack can also be used to successfully navigate the journey of life. Comedy drama, starring Milo Ventimiglia and Amanda Seyfried

programme.title: The Cockleshell Heroes (1955)
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War drama in which eight British Marines carry out a daring operation to canoe into Bordeaux harbour, where they plan to sabotage the German fleet - a mission considered by many to be suicidal. Directed by and starring Jose Ferrer. With Trevor Howard, Dora Bryan and Anthony Newley

programme.title: The Colditz Story (1954)
programme.desc: A medieval castle in Germany is turned into a PoW camp during the Second World War, and used to house the most rebellious Allied prisoners, all of whom have made repeated escape attempts. Although breaking out is supposedly impossible, the determined inmates refuse to be beaten and continue their bid for freedom. Second World War drama, starring John Mills and Eric Portman

programme.title: Airplane II: The Sequel (1982)
programme.desc: Hapless hero Ted Striker tries to prevent the launch of a passenger space shuttle, certain it will end in disaster. Sadly, his prediction comes true when a computer malfunction sends the spacecraft hurtling toward the sun, while a man driven mad by sexual inadequacy smuggles a bomb on board. Disaster movie spoof sequel, starring Robert Hays, Julie Hagerty, Lloyd Bridges, William Shatner, Sonny Bono and Chad Everett

programme.title: Armageddon (1998)
programme.desc: Nasa discovers an asteroid the size of Texas is on a collision course with Earth, so a drilling expert is recruited to train a team of misfits to transport a nuclear device into outer space to destroy it - but having had no experience of space travel, the reluctant astronauts find themselves seriously out of their depth. Sci-fi thriller, with Bruce Willis, Ben Affleck, Liv Tyler, Michael Clarke Duncan, Billy Bob Thornton and Steve Buscemi

programme.title: Happy Death Day 2U (2019)
programme.desc: College student Tree Gelbman repeatedly lived through her own murder at the hands of a killer in a baby mask, until she learned how to outwit him and escape her fate. However, she is now stuck in another murderous time-loop, and has to face up to a fresh killer. Horror comedy sequel, starring Jessica Rothe, Israel Broussard and Phi Vu

programme.title: Loving Vincent (2017)
programme.desc: Animated biographical drama examining the life of painter Vincent van Gogh, focusing on the circumstances of his death. The production, which utilised 65,000 oil-painted frames, features the voices of Douglas Booth, Robert Gulaczyk and Eleanor Tomlinson

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: John Paul is attacked as he leaves a club night at The Loft, Cindy wakes up in hospital and has to face reality, and Yazz and Tom feel a strain on their relationship

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil and Claire have a massive falling out, and they are lent a friendly ear by Gloria and Jay respectively as they think about what went wrong. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

Comedy, guest starring June Squibb

Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at Ambles House in Northampton, where Amanda hopes her homely hospitality will win over her guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Richard and Harriet Secular pride themselves on their high-end rooms at the Royal George in Tintern in Monmouthshire - and the guests are not disappointed, with plenty of praise for the hosts throughout the two days. Will the feedback mirror their experience?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet up for a final showdown, as Kaye and Lily bring Harriet and Richard's blind issues to light before dishing the dirt on Sophie and David's discoveries. Amanda wants to know why frank feelings were unleased when it came to her canine companion, Trudy. David and Sophie banish Harriet and Richard's bathroom blues, before confronting Kaye and Lily with their cleanliness critique. After opinions are aired and differences debated, the payments are revealed and the winner is announced

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: It's nightfall at Chester and the zoo's 800 nocturnal inhabitants start to wake up. Aardvark Koos is showing a potentially romantic interest in his sister Himba, but the zoo needs to ensure that their animals are breeding from the right genetic pool. It's also time for mouse-deer Una to leave her parents and meet a mate

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Documentary set inside Woodgreen animal charity. Londoners Roshni and Jay meet two very different dogs - Bella the confident, playful Staffie, and Cech the shy but cuddly terrier. Bella seems to warm to Jay, but it's Roshni who has the final say. Olivia the blind spaniel is looking for a home and funeral workers Amy and Alex want to rescue a dog in need

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Gallery owner Elinor and fitness entrepreneur Born set themselves the task of creating Britain's first hypoallergenic house in a leafy back garden plot in south-west London. Driven by the need to alleviate their two young sons' life-threatening allergies, their new part-submerged, shed-inspired home, will be constructed using low toxin materials and deploy cutting-edge filtration systems to clean the air they breathe. Will their innovative new house deliver the benefits Elinor and Born are hoping for?

programme.title: Jamie's 1 Wonders
programme.desc: Jamie shares clever ways to make meat stretch further, preparing meatball kebabs on a bed of creamy lentils and rice, and crispy pork noodles with sticky ginger and garlic, making super-speedy homemade noodles from just flour and water. Plus, Karan Gokani shares some tips on Sri Lankan cooking that can deliver takeaway flavours without takeaway prices

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Documentary featuring real-life footage - from the funny to the dramatic - showing what can go wrong both on and off the train tracks. From shocking near-misses and devastating derailments to rush-hour rage and unique on-board entertainment, all captured on cameras and phones and told by the people who witnessed and survived them. Plus, psychologists and industry experts discuss train-related anxieties and situations that passengers could experience in and around the railways

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Anthony is rushed to resus after coming off his motor scooter on his 18th birthday. Doctors are concerned that he has internal bleeding. Sixteen-year-old Jack is urgently transferred from another hospital with multiple fractures and nerve damage in his arm after he fell off his electric scooter. After twisting his ankle at school, 13-year-old Josh has been brought to the emergency department by his father, Sanjay, who explains how he left India for the UK to pursue a career as a chef

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: The heli-medics race to assist Linda, who has suffered a heart attack on a Norfolk beach. Motocross rider Alex is in a bad way after being hit by another bike. Meanwhile, in Cumbria, 15-year-old cyclist Dan is treated for a possible skull fracture after colliding with a car on a country road

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A woman at the airport suffers a suspected miscarriage, but the paramedics sent to her aid have trouble getting her back to hospital due to heavy snowfall. Crews also battle through the roads to treat a woman semi-conscious in police custody with collapsed veins

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Anthony is rushed to resus after coming off his motor scooter on his 18th birthday. Doctors are concerned that he has internal bleeding. After twisting his ankle at school, 13-year-old Josh has been brought to the emergency department by his father, Sanjay, who explains how he left India for the UK to pursue a career as a chef

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty heads to Paris to find out why baguettes go stale so much faster than sliced loaves of bread. Matt Tebbutt is in Italy to investigate why buffalo mozzarella is much more expensive than that from cows and Briony May Williams discovers the surprising secret to the making of mushy peas

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: In this bite-sized episode, Kirstie Allsopp plans to surprise her guests with two main courses - roast beef with mulled wine gravy, and masala cauliflower with coconut stuffing for the vegetarians

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Colin and Richard from Glasgow love Playa del Ingles in Gran Canaria and have been holidaying there for over 20 years. With retirement approaching, they feel now's the perfect time to buy their dream holiday home there to escape the Scottish winters and spend up to six months of the year in the sunshine. Jean Johansson lines up five potential properties for their budget of 200,000, but will any of them seem the perfect place?

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A couple await permission for their glampsite in France, a new B&B opens in Portugal and a Norfolk family leave the UK for Italy - but their journey is far from plain sailing

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Hampshire and Surrey, where Henry makes a pair of coffee tables from a cable drum and a galvanised water tank, and Simon rescues a winged back chair and upholsters it with his own designer fabric

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Redditch where Henry restores a 1970s Kawasaki motorbike, while Simon takes a pair of rusty cinema seat supports and creates a desirable garden bench

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers are surprised to discover two unclaimed estates in the same family. The team also explains how an heir hunt led to a story of Antarctic exploration. Plus, details of more cases are revealed

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: A member of the team celebrates retirement, while research into the estate of a Scottish woman reveals two generations of coachmen who worked during the dawn of the motoring age. Plus, details of unclaimed estates for which heirs still need to be found

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Claire Hilton, who runs Robertsbrook Guest House in Swanage, Dorset, feels she has a good chance of winning the title of best B&B as another round of the competition gets under way. However, guests Lynn Self and Ziggy Broome have doubts over the cleanliness of their bedroom, and another couple are accustomed to more opulent surroundings

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Lynn Self and Ziggy Broome hope to impress with their two-star B&B Eden Lodge in Falmouth, Cornwall. However, the state of their property disappoints their fellow competitors. At dinner, James and Maria Church reveal the truth about their famous daughter Charlotte, and the following morning's breakfast reduces some of the guests to fits of giggles

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: It is the turn of Charlotte Church's parents James and Maria to play host at Dexby Townhouse in Cardiff, and they pull out all the stops by laying on a day of white-water rafting and a magic performance courtesy of their nephew Elliot. But the following morning, some of the guests are kept waiting for breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Newlyweds Pip Easby and Nicky Lesser-Easby, who run Muddifords Court Country House in Devon, open their doors for the final stay of the competition. The Churches find their four-poster bed too small, and not all the guests enjoy their trip to a local glass-blowing factory, but feedback at check-out time leaves the hosts feeling confident

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. An underpayment from a surprising source changes the dynamics of the group and throws the competition wide open, before the winner is announced

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Orang-utan sisters Emma and Subis are due to give birth at the same time, but after being in labour for more than 24 hours with no progress, Subis is rushed to the vet for a possible C-section. Meerkats Beagle and Huskie have moved to the zoo as the new breeding pair, but their new housemates, the aardvarks, are making them anxious. In an effort to make them more comfortable in their new home, the team decide to redesign the paddock to give the meerkats their own space

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Daily life inside Woodgreen animal charity, following staff who are committed to matching their homeless dogs with prospective owners. Patch the border collie displays an impressive array of tricks to try to convince horse groomer Megan that he's a smart choice for her. Pebbles the Lhasa is a firm sofa addict and a bit on the chunky side. She's matched with David, a Paralympian and workaholic

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Spanish architect Jaime and his wife Mimi as they embark on a mission to convert a Grade II-listed folly into a family home in Buckinghamshire. Giving themselves a wildly optimistic six-month deadline to finish before the birth of their second child, it's not long before the couple hit trouble. Jaime puts all his energies and creativity into the project, using innovative 3D mapping to squeeze living spaces into the tower, but it proves to be an exhausting struggle

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Doctors at St George's in south London treat a cyclist who collided with a stampede of deer, and are concerned about the extent of blood loss from the puncture wounds. A mother of two who had a heart attack three weeks previously now fears she is having another, and an 18-month-old child has developed a limp

programme.title: Belfast Midwives
programme.desc: Laura and Andrew met online and are now saying hello to their first baby together. Fatima comes into the unit worried about her high blood pressure leaving midwife Courtney and Dr Sammy Jo fearing pre-eclampsia. The pair decide to induce her and the rush is on for husband Rahim to arrive in time for the birth. In the Active Birth Centre first time parents Louise and Darragh are hoping for a natural, easy water birth but the baby has other ideas. Midwife Jenna decide to take action

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A man who has already had one arm amputated at 13 after a factory accident cuts his hand in a blender while cooking for his family. He relates the story of how he came to the UK and never let the loss of his arm hold him back. Other patients include a woman with cerebral palsy and learning difficulties who has suffered a suspected stroke

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: The heli-medics race to assist Linda, who has suffered a heart attack on a Norfolk beach. Motocross rider Alex is in a bad way after being hit by another bike. programme.title: 999: On the Front Line

Meanwhile in Birmingham, a crew rushes to save a man with a history of heart attacks who is suffering chest pains at work

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Helen Lawal searches for the secret to perfectly shelled walnuts in California, and Matt Tebbutt hopes to discover what makes sweets sour. Andi Oliver investigates how the cloud gets into the hazy beers that are so trendy currently

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty visits Mauritius to find out about white and dark rum and learns where the term 'proof' originally came from in relation to alcohol

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lynne and her sister Debbie seek the perfect place on the beautiful Costa Teguise in Lanzarote. After Lynne's husband Frankie was diagnosed with a terminal illness, Lynne took early retirement to care for him. A holiday home in the sun has been a lifelong dream for this couple, and with Frankie's illness they don't want to wait any longer. With a budget of 150,000, Ben Hillman lines up five suitable properties for them to choose between

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A family of five begin searching for their dream home in Italy, and it's panic stations in France as the glampsite hosts prepare for their first guests

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Wales, where Henry restores a Royal Enfield motorbike, converting it into a classic cafe racer. Simon's choice of an old school house radiator springs a leak, but he gets an 1980s pinball machine back to its best

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien search for more items to fix up and sell on, visiting Windsor to meet Pete and Phil, who rent out cars to the film and TV business. Henry finds an Austrian moped which is missing an engine, while Simon picks a fibreglass suit of armour

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers look for the heirs of a newly advertised estate, and learn that a family member once made lace for Queen Victoria. Plus, two sisters embark on a journey of discovery when it is revealed they are descendants of someone they never knew existed

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate officers work on the case of a 1.3million estate belonging to a retired policeman and share the story of an investigation that took them to Ireland. Plus, the team reveals more details of unclaimed assets

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Brigitte Tee, who runs four-star B&B Gorse Meadow in the New Forest, hosts the first round of the competition. Her guests are initially charmed by her eccentric personality, but the discovery of a bathroom window in need of repair and another room containing ladybirds, cobwebs and dust soon takes the shine off their stay

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants head to Lynton in north Devon, where they stay at Alistair and Emma Mundell's four-star Castle Hill Guesthouse. The pair only opened the B&B three months prior to the competition, and hope to impress with their recently renovated rooms, but Brigitte Tee proves hard to win over. Two of their guests are also forced to overcome their fears during a trip on a Victorian cliff railway

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves north to Blackpool and the three-star Vidella B&B run by John Downer and Neil Williams. The pair rig Blackpool-hater Alistair Mundell's room with practical jokes, and take their guests to Funny Girls drag cabaret bar, where Mark Crib confesses he has never had such a surreal time

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Entrepreneur Mark Crib welcomes the group to the Urban Beach in Bournemouth, Dorset, for the week's final B&B visit. The boutique establishment features chic rooms with deluxe bathrooms, and the guests approve of the afternoon's activity - a speedboat ride along the Jurassic coast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Brigitte Tee is upset to discover she has been given only one point for cleanliness and a heated exchange results in a walk-out, before the winner is announced

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: African painted dogs K'mana and Ville were thrown together as a breeding couple after the dominant female died, but K'mana was never Ville's first choice as partner and still carries a limp from her battles with Ville's previous mate. Now she is pregnant with the zoo's first ever litter of this rare and endangered species. Meanwhile, keepers try to rekindle interest between Okapi pair Dicky and Stuma, and Atlas moths Dave and Simon only have five days of life after hatching, and their sole purpose is to mate

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Woodgreen animal charity staff set about matching their homeless dogs with more prospective owners. Eighty-five-year-old Pim thinks Dexter the beagle is as stubborn as Elizabeth, his wife of 62 years. It's possible that shy Jack Russell Roxy could prove a better match. Chihuahuas Bear and Dave try to convince seven-year-old husky-fan Ollie that two little dogs are better than one

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Dorran, who has taken on the ambitious task of building a super-modern underground home on a hill outside Canterbury. He entrusts the work to a team of contractors, but when delays and rising costs force him to take charge of the build himself, Dorran faces the biggest challenge of his life, juggling his time between the site and his work as a ship's master out on the North Sea. However, having promised the house to his wife and children, he knows that failure is not an option

programme.title: Bismarck: 24 Hours to Doom
programme.desc: Documentary about the famous Second World War naval battle, charting the sinking of HMS Hood by the German Navy's newest and most powerful battleship, the Bismarck. programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics Jan Vann and Chelsie Kennedy rush to a road traffic collision, but find the driver of the car has left the vehicle and doesn't want to be treated by the crew. programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo travels through the landscape of Tuscany, beginning in the city of Siena, famous for its sloping Piazza del Campo and its 'panforte' - a rich, spiced fruit-and-nut cake dating back to the 13th century. The chef tastes this ancient Christmas treat and, inspired by its flavour combinations, creates his own chocolate version. Next, he visits some Benedictine monks and tours their vast vineyard, before using their Tuscan red wine in his recipe for marinated beef skewers and three-bean salad

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: The final leg of Gino D'Acampo's tour takes him to Bologna, widely regarded as Italy's gastronomic capital. Making his way to a trattoria, he meets a chef who has been honing her bolognese sauce recipe for almost 30 years. Gino then prepares his grandfather's take on tagliatelle alla bolognese and explores the local speciality of mortadella. Finally, he goes on the trail of the region's distinctive local pasta - tortellini - and creates his own version with ricotta cheese, hazelnuts, orange zest and chocolate chips

He learns about the prized dish of roasted suckling pig - and hosts a traditional Festa for his friends. Then he heads to the north of the island, visiting Alghero, a medieval walled town. He heads to a working farm where he meets a shepherd who explains how the simple food from the land sustains the Sardi people, then samples native moonshine. programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson examines the history of Lindisfarne, which lies off the Northumberland coast. From what became known as the Holy Island of Lindisfarne, monks spread Christianity to the rest of northern England and created one of Britain's finest treasures - the Lindisfarne Gospels. Viking attacks caused the monks to flee but the village survived and today the community has to share it with thousands of tourists

Director Christian Gudegast's crime drama, starring Gerard Butler and Jordan Bridges

programme.title: Chernobyl: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Using previously classified KGB documents, the second part of this film explores how far Soviet leaders were willing to go to cover up the Chernobyl disaster, including exposing children to toxic fallout at the Kyiv May Day parade to prove to the world that all was fine. Featuring first-hand accounts from those who survived the blast, including Oleksiy Ananenko, who braved radioactive waters to prevent a deadlier second explosion and Maryna Sivets, whose unborn child's life was put at risk

programme.title: The Secret World of...
programme.desc: Dawn French narrates this behind-the-scenes look at the biggest players in Britain's crisp industry. The snack aisle is a brutal place, where every cheesy puff, crisp and tortilla chip fights for its place on the shelf. This programme meets the crisp industry's biggest players, whose job it was to make sure their brand stays ahead of the competition, no matter what. It's a fierce battleground where three brands - Smiths, Golden Wonder and Walkers - have fought for decades to out-flavour, out-sell and outwit their rivals to achieve complete crisp domination
