programme.desc: A new student enrols in the imposing form of a four-year-old newfador called Ruby. Eight-stone of solid dog, Ruby refuses to budge when owners Nichola and Zeal take her for a walk. However, trainers Sean and Kamal soon there's more to Ruby's stubbornness than meets the eye. Six-year-old Maltese Bichon cross Marco arrives with fed up owner Beth in tow. Beth inherited Marco from her late father - and Marco's repaying the favour by ignoring every word Beth says

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Personal assistant Lisa hosts the first of five parties from in and around Birmingham, with the 53-year-old self-proclaimed domestic goddess hoping a menu straight from her Malaysian roots will impress other contestants Akil, Sonia, Martha and Mark

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is day two of the competition in Birmingham, and 37-year-old shopping channel producer Martha is hoping to educate - as well as entertain - her guests with a vegan feast

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mark hosts the third night of the culinary competition taking place in Birmingham, hoping to impress his guests with a menu of classic comfort food

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Youth worker Sonia is in charge on day four in Birmingham and after three nights of vegan chat from Martha, the host makes a pact with the others to ban any mention of the subject

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final day of the competition in Birmingham sees 32-year-old aquarium designer Akil act as host, hoping to create a splash with his fish-themed menu. With a home-made seafood tempura to start and a double whammy of sea bass and scallops for the main, Akil goes all out to impress

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: Jayne and Steve are pulled from pillar to post as they host a residential landscape painting course, while Emma goes all out to faithfully restore the wartime dcor in Normandy

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman and Laura Hamilton offer their help to Margaret Wagstaff and Keith Turner, who want to spend their retirement somewhere other than Aylesbury, Buckinghamshire, but are unable to decide whether they will get more for their money in Cornwall or Collioure, south-west France. Keith has fond memories of family holidays in the West Country, while Margaret is drawn to the artists' paradise of Collioure

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps workaholics David and Karen who cannot decide whether to buy a place to escape to in Dorset or the alpine city of Graz in Austria. Jasmine reveals what their 130,000 budget will get them in both locations

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Sharon and Steve Garner are looking for the perfect home in the Spanish sun for NHS worker Jo and marine upholsterer Lee from Southampton. Armed with a 300,000 budget the pair search for a three bedroom property with outside space for their dog and a workshop space for Lee's business in Almeria. In Alicante, Sophie and Charlotte Rodriguez hunt for a getaway in the sun for Susan and James from Glasgow who have a budget of 200,000, a dislike for terracotta and a love of all things modern

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Make-up artist and female impersonator Marcus Hunter-Neill hopes to impress with a red carpet-themed evening as he hosts the first party in Belfast. However, his alter ego Lady Portia Diamante steals the limelight as he competes for the 1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jamaican lifeguard Lenny Irving serves up Caribbean cuisine at the second of the week's dinner parties in Belfast. He also hopes to win over his guests by complementing his menu with strong rum - and seems particularly keen to impress Merchant Navy officer Fiona Rush

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Freelance feminist writer Cat Anderson hosts the third dinner party in Belfast, and hopes to win over her guests with her bohemian chic style and live music. However, her efforts are wasted on lifeguard Lenny Irving, who is only interested in Fiona Rush

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The fourth dinner-party challenge from Belfast is hosted by charity worker and confident cook Rosie Smyth. She decides the best way to win over her guests is to have a 'come-as-your-teenage-self' evening, and a zingy mojito cheesecake

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Merchant Navy officer Fiona Rush hosts the final dinner party in Belfast, and hopes to impress with a nautical-themed evening. However, one of her guests is unimpressed with the amount of fish on the menu, before the winner of the 1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Newlyweds Debbie and John have decided that it's time to say goodbye to their busy careers in healthcare in Wales and live the good life on the sunny Costa del Sol. Together with their much-loved dogs, Dolly and Betty, they want a 'forever home' in Benalmdena. With a budget of 250,000 and expert help from Jean Johansson, they set out to find a dream home to start married life in Spain

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: In 2003, Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp were tasked with finding homes that would bring two pairs of lovebirds together. A frustrating 10-mile gap was keeping Annmarie and Robert apart, while 300 miles separated Alison and Martin. Twelve years later, the hosts find out whether either or both couples remain together in the United Kingdom

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: Liam Charles and Ellie Taylor challenge six new teams to produce 36 perfect Prinsesstrta alongside a chocolate amenity with no recipe to help them. The contestants then transform a classic dessert into a fine-dining experience, taking the humble bread and butter pudding and turning it into a towering, edible, showpiece sculpture

programme.title: Sky Coppers
programme.desc: The team join the search for a woman who has left a suicide note and vanished into the night. And officers are shocked when they arrive at a house to discover a gang cruelly breeding 'dangerous' dogs in horrific conditions

programme.title: Britain's Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: Amy, director of the country office, visits a 1930s property in Surrey boasting eight acres of award-winning grounds, an on-site recording studio, circular rooms, horizontal curved windows and terraces with views of the gardens. Once belonging to Roxy Music guitarist Paul Manzanera, it's an exciting listing for Amy who is on the hunt for a buyer willing to pay 5.45million or a tenant with 20,500 per month to spend. Mo entrusts Natalie with a new listing - an enormous three-storey converted factory in the heart of Spitalfields worth 2.3million. programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Letting agents Karen and Gemma investigate claims of vandalism and anti-social behaviour at a property they manage in Wigan, but when they discover the tenant is no longer living there, they track her down to learn that she's abandoned the property and has tried to move in somewhere else by forging a reference. Meanwhile, in Darwen, letting agent Paul issues proceedings on a tenant who is more than 3,000 in arrears, but Paul's attempts at evicting him are delayed when the tenant refuses to leave without Paul giving him a good reference

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Yorkshire police forces tackling an ever-more sophisticated criminal fraternity from the cities to the Dales. programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the case of a Hispanic man found dead from a severe chest trauma after being involved in a staged car accident with two other illegal immigrants - and soon find evidence linking similar incidents with the same employer, chiropractor and insurance adjuster. Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin star

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a student who proves to be the estranged son of a powerful real-estate tycoon. The finger of blame points to a mystery woman seen with the victim outside the college, and when tracked down, she claims to be his sister. However, Briscoe is not convinced, and suspects an extortion scheme

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green are convinced that former career criminal Cally Lonegan has killed his business partner who had been stealing company money. However, their suspect has a cast iron alibi - he is a Mob informant and at the time of the murder was being followed by the FBI. The case takes a more complicated turn when an eyewitness is found dead and the detectives discover Lonegan has a twin brother

programme.title: NCIS

While the task force questions who they can really trust, Red calls on a Blacklister known as The Troll Farmer to help them escape the city. Meanwhile, Dembe is placed in a dangerous and compromising position

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

Naval crime drama, guest starring Scott Bakula

Meanwhile, a storm causes a massive power outage, and McGee seeks a room for the night among his colleagues. Naval crime drama, starring Sean Murray

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: A classic episode of the award-winning quiz show presented by Chris Tarrant in which contestants can win up to one million pounds.

programme.title: Strike It Lucky
programme.desc: Michael Barrymore hosts the madcap game show, in which three teams of two prove seek to progress along a board game-style path by answering questions. Each duo are allowed to determine how many spaces they would like to move by answering the corresponding number of questions. Landing on a space reveals it's hidden contents, which could amount to a prize, or a 'hot spot', which causes contestants to forfeit their gathered winnings
